analyzed: klog tu gzhug par 'dod / lung 'bog par 'dod / kha ton byed du gzhug par 'dod /
translated: wishes to have it read,🔽wishes to have it transmitted,

original: smra bar 'dod la /
analyzed: smra bar 'dod la /
translated: wishes to have it recited,🔽and wishes to talk about it for the sake of a little bit of material things,

original: chos nyan pa ni zang zing cung zad kyi phyir drung du 'gro bar ma mos na /
analyzed: chos nyan pa ni zang zing cung zad kyi phyir drung du 'gro bar ma mos na /
translated: but the Dharma listener is not keen on going into his presence for the sake of a little bit of material things,

original: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
translated: Subhūti, this is also a condition that is not conducive to the writing,

original: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sbyin par mi 'dod / nyan par gzhug pa'i bar du mi 'dod na /
translated: but the Dharma teacher does not wish to give the perfection of wisdom,🔽to cause listening, and so forth, for the sake of a small amount of material things.

analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu @359b phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /

original: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
translated: Subhūti, that also is a condition that does not lead to writing out, expounding, or chanting this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / de'ang @360a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang @360a *//
translated: Subhūti, that also

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: should be known by bodhisattva great beings as the work of Māra.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang chos nyan pa ni gang na zas dkon pa dang / chu dkon pa'i phyogs der 'gro bar 'dod la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang chos nyan pa ni gang na zas dkon pa dang / chu dkon pa'i phyogs der 'gro bar 'dod la /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, if the Dharma listener wants to go to a place where food is scarce and water is scarce,

original: chos smra ba ni der 'gro bar mi 'dod na /
analyzed: chos smra ba ni der 'gro bar mi 'dod na /
translated: but the Dharma teacher does not want to go there,

original: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
translated: Subhūti, that also is a condition that does not have the causal basis for writing out, receiving the transmission of, and reciting this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, that also should be recognized by bodhisattva great beings as the work of Māra.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang chos smra ba ni gang na zas mod pa dang / chu mod pa'i phyogs der 'gro bar 'dod la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang chos smra ba ni gang na zas mod pa dang / chu mod pa'i phyogs der 'gro bar 'dod la /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, if the Dharma teacher wants to go to a place where food is plentiful and water is plentiful,

original: chos nyan pa'ang rjes su 'brang na /
analyzed: chos nyan pa'ang rjes su 'brang na /
translated: but the Dharma listener follows him,

original: des de la 'di skad du rigs kyi bu khyod zang zing gi don du song ste ci rung /
analyzed: des de la 'di skad du rigs kyi bu khyod zang zing gi don du song ste ci rung /
translated: the Dharma teacher should say to him, ‘Son of noble family, what is the point of your going for the sake of material things?

original: legs par bsam pa sems par gyis shig /
analyzed: legs par bsam pa sems par gyis shig /
translated: You should think well and consider it.

original: zas thob ma thob dang / bsod mi bsod kyis 'gyod par gyur ta re zhes zer na /
analyzed: zas thob ma thob dang / bsod mi bsod kyis 'gyod par gyur ta re zhes zer na /
translated: and whether they have obtained food or not, whether they have gained merit or not, they will regret it.

original: de'i phyir chos ston pa des kyang /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos ston pa des kyang /
translated: Therefore, that teacher of the Dharma

original: thabs phra mos chos la spang ba byas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: thabs phra mos chos la spang ba byas par 'gyur te /
translated: will have rejected the Dharma through subtle means.

original: de'ang mi dga' zhing 'di snyam du 'du shes te /🔽'di ni sbyin par 'dod pa'i mtshan ma ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de'ang mi dga' zhing 'di snyam du 'du shes te / 'di ni sbyin par 'dod pa'i mtshan ma ma yin gyi /
translated: And he will be unhappy and think,🔽‘This is not a sign of wanting to give,

original: spong ba'i mtshan ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: spong ba'i mtshan ma yin no snyam na /
translated: this is a sign of wanting to reject.’

original: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
translated: Subhūti, that also is a condition that is not conducive to this profound perfection of wisdom being written out, taken up,

original: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, that also should be known by the bodhisattva great beings as the work of Māra.”🔽“

original: rab 'byor / @360b gzhan yang dge slong chos smra ba ni gang na rkun po'i 'jigs pa dang / chom po'i 'jigs pa dang / rngon pa'i 'jigs pa dang / gcan gzan khro bo'i 'jigs pa dang / sprul gyi 'jigs pa dang / 'brog dgon pa'i 'jigs pa yod pa der 'gro bar 'dod la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / @360b gzhan yang dge slong chos smra ba ni gang na rkun po'i 'jigs pa dang / chom po'i 'jigs pa dang / rngon pa'i 'jigs pa dang / gcan gzan khro bo'i 'jigs pa dang / sprul gyi 'jigs pa dang / 'brog dgon pa'i 'jigs pa yod pa der 'gro bar 'dod la /
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, the monk who teaches the Dharma may wish to go to a place where there are dangers from thieves, robbers, hunters, wild beasts, snakes, or deserts.

original: chos nyan pa dag kyang chos kyi don du chos kyis skom zhing rjes su 'brang na /
analyzed: chos nyan pa dag kyang chos kyi don du chos kyis skom zhing rjes su 'brang na /
translated: But the listeners, who are thirsty for the Dharma and follow him for the sake of the Dharma,

original: dge slong chos smra bas chos nyan pa de dag la 'di skad smras te /
analyzed: dge slong chos smra bas chos nyan pa de dag la 'di skad smras te /
translated: the monk who teaches the Dharma may say to them:

original: rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag /
translated: 'Noble Sirs,

original: khyed gang na rkun po'i 'jigs pa dang / chom po'i 'jigs pa dang / rngon pa'i 'jigs pa dang / gcan gzan khro bo'i 'jigs pa dang / sbrul gyi 'jigs pa dang / 'brog dgon pa'i 'jigs pa yod pa der dong ste ci rung zhes /
analyzed: khyed gang na rkun po'i 'jigs pa dang / chom po'i 'jigs pa dang / rngon pa'i 'jigs pa dang / gcan gzan khro bo'i 'jigs pa dang / sbrul gyi 'jigs pa dang / 'brog dgon pa'i 'jigs pa yod pa der dong ste ci rung zhes /
translated: what is the use of going to a place where there are dangers from thieves, robbers, hunters, wild beasts, snakes, or deserts?'

original: de ltar dge slong chos smra ba des chos mi bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar dge slong chos smra ba des chos mi bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: And because of that, the monk who teaches the Dharma does not teach the Dharma.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'drir gzhug par mi 'dod /🔽klog tu gzhug par mi 'dod /🔽lung 'bog par mi 'dod /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'drir gzhug par mi 'dod / klog tu gzhug par mi 'dod / lung 'bog par mi 'dod /
translated: they do not want to have this profound perfection of wisdom written out,🔽they do not want to have it recited,🔽they do not want to have it taken up,

original: kha ton byed du gzhug par mi 'dod /
analyzed: kha ton byed du gzhug par mi 'dod /
translated: they do not want to have it studied,

original: nyan du gzhug par mi 'dod par gyur la /
analyzed: nyan du gzhug par mi 'dod par gyur la /
translated: they do not want to have it heard.

original: de dag gis dge slong chos smra ba'i tshig de thos nas /
analyzed: de dag gis dge slong chos smra ba'i tshig de thos nas /
translated: When they hear the words of the monk who expounds the doctrine,

original: mi dga' zhing mi dga' ba'i tshul can du gyur te /
analyzed: mi dga' zhing mi dga' ba'i tshul can du gyur te /
translated: they become displeased and hostile,

original: dge slong chos smra ba gang na ba der 'gro bar mi 'dod na /
analyzed: dge slong chos smra ba gang na ba der 'gro bar mi 'dod na /
translated: and do not want to go to where the monk who expounds the doctrine is.🔽Subhūti, that also is not the causal condition for writing out,

original: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /🔽rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi @361a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste / rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi @361a *//
translated: expounding, or reciting this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: las su rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, that also should be known by bodhisattva great beings as the work of Māra.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang dge slong chos smra ba bsod snyoms gtong ba'i grong khyer gtso bor byed par gyur te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang dge slong chos smra ba bsod snyoms gtong ba'i grong khyer gtso bor byed par gyur te /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, a monk who teaches the Dharma will make a city that gives alms his main concern.

original: de bsod snyoms gtong ba'i grong khyer gtso bor gyur pas /🔽bsod snyoms gtong ba'i grong khyer de dag yang dang yang blta bar sems shing /
analyzed: de bsod snyoms gtong ba'i grong khyer gtso bor gyur pas / bsod snyoms gtong ba'i grong khyer de dag yang dang yang blta bar sems shing /
translated: Because he makes a city that gives alms his main concern,🔽he will think again and again about that city that gives alms.

original: der yang dang yang blta bas chos nyan pa phyir zlog cing /
analyzed: der yang dang yang blta bas chos nyan pa phyir zlog cing /
translated: Because he thinks again and again about that city that gives alms, he will turn away those who listen to the Dharma.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag /
translated: He will say, ‘Venerable ones,

original: ngas ni bsod snyoms gtong ba'i grong blta dgos te /
analyzed: ngas ni bsod snyoms gtong ba'i grong blta dgos te /
translated: I need to see the city that gives alms.

original: bsod snyoms gtong ba'i grong du 'gro dgos so zhes nas /
analyzed: bsod snyoms gtong ba'i grong du 'gro dgos so zhes nas /
translated: I need to go to the city that gives alms.’

original: des chos nyan pa de dag phyir zlog pas phyir dong na /
analyzed: des chos nyan pa de dag phyir zlog pas phyir dong na /
translated: Because he turns away those who listen to the Dharma, they will leave.

original: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
translated: Subhūti, this is also a causal factor that prevents this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom from being written down, from being received in oral transmission, and from being recited aloud.

original: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, this also should be known as the work of Māra by the bodhisattva great beings.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang bdud sdig to can dge slong gi cha byad du byas shing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang bdud sdig to can dge slong gi cha byad du byas shing /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, Māra the wicked one, having taken on the appearance of a monk,

original: ci nas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di su yang 'dri bar mi 'gyur ba dang / lung 'bog par mi 'gyur ba dang / kha ton byed par mi 'gyur ba dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed par mi 'gyur ba de lta de ltar thabs sbyor ro //
analyzed: ci nas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di su yang 'dri bar mi 'gyur ba dang / lung 'bog par mi 'gyur ba dang / kha ton byed par mi 'gyur ba dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed par mi 'gyur ba de lta de ltar thabs sbyor ro //
translated: will apply himself in such a way that no one will ask about this profound perfection of wisdom, will not receive it orally, will not recite it, and will not properly pay attention to it.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
translated: When this had been said, the venerable Subhūti

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: said to the Lord:

original: @361b bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: @361b bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: ci'i slad du bdud sdig to can dag dge slong gi cha byad du bgyis shing /
analyzed: ci'i slad du bdud sdig to can dag dge slong gi cha byad du bgyis shing /
translated: why do Māra the wicked one and his followers take on the appearance of monks,

original: ci nas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di su'ang 'dri bar mi 'gyur ba dang; lung 'bog par mi 'gyur ba dang / kha ton bgyid par mi 'gyur ba dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid par mi 'gyur ba de lta de ltar thabs sbyor ba lags /
analyzed: ci nas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di su'ang 'dri bar mi 'gyur ba dang; lung 'bog par mi 'gyur ba dang / kha ton bgyid par mi 'gyur ba dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid par mi 'gyur ba de lta de ltar thabs sbyor ba lags /
translated: or properly pay attention to it.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor 'di la bdud sdig to can dag dge slong gi cha byad du byas shing 'di skad du nged kyis ji ltar khong du chud pa 'di ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor 'di la bdud sdig to can dag dge slong gi cha byad du byas shing 'di skad du nged kyis ji ltar khong du chud pa 'di ni /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti, here the evil Māra, disguised as a monk, will say, ‘This is the perfection of wisdom

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yin te /
translated: as we understand it.

original: ji skad du khyed klog pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du khyed klog pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no //
translated: What you are reading is not the perfection of wisdom.’

original: zhes dbyen byed cing zlog la mos pa med par byed do //
analyzed: zhes dbyen byed cing zlog la mos pa med par byed do //
translated: He will cause division, turn them away, and make them lose interest.

original: rab 'byor / de la bdud sdig to can gyis de ltar dbyen byas pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de la bdud sdig to can gyis de ltar dbyen byas pa'i tshe /
translated: “Subhūti, when the evil Māra has thus caused division,

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang lung ma bstan pa de dag ni the tshom skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang lung ma bstan pa de dag ni the tshom skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Those bodhisattvas who are not predicted will be doubtful.

original: de dag the tshom du gyur nas /
analyzed: de dag the tshom du gyur nas /
translated: And being doubtful,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di mi 'dri bar 'gyur /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di mi 'dri bar 'gyur /
translated: they will not ask about this deep perfection of wisdom,

original: mi klog par 'gyur /🔽lung mi 'bog par 'gyur /🔽kha ton mi byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: mi klog par 'gyur / lung mi 'bog par 'gyur / kha ton mi byed par 'gyur /
translated: they will not read it,🔽they will not take it up,🔽they will not recite it,

original: mi sgom par 'gyur /
analyzed: mi sgom par 'gyur /
translated: they will not meditate on it,

original: tshul bzhin du yid la mi byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la mi byed par 'gyur te /
translated: they will not properly pay attention to it.🔽Subhūti, that also is a causal factor that is not conducive to writing out,

original: rab 'byor; de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /🔽rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems @362a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor; de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste / rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems @362a *//
translated: reading aloud, or clearly articulating this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should know that also to be the work of Māra.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang bdud sdig to can dag dge slong gi cha byad du byas nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang bdud sdig to can dag dge slong gi cha byad du byas nas /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, Māra the wicked one, having made himself into the form of a monk,🔽will come into the presence of bodhisattva great beings

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du 'ongs shing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du 'ongs shing /
translated: and say,

original: 'di skad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa de ni yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa de ni yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du byed par 'gyur te /
translated: They say, The bodhisattva great beings who practice this deep perfection of wisdom will realize the very limit of reality.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will attain the fruit of stream enterer.

original: de ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will attain the fruit of once-returner, the fruit of non-returner, and the state of a worthy one.

original: de ni rang byang chub thob par 'gyur ro //🔽zhes zer na /
analyzed: de ni rang byang chub thob par 'gyur ro // zhes zer na /
translated: They will attain a pratyekabuddha’s awakening.

original: des tshig de thos nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod na /
analyzed: des tshig de thos nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod na /
translated: If, having heard those words, they do not practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
translated: Subhūti, that also is not a condition for writing out, explaining, or reciting this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, those bodhisattva great beings should know that to be the work of Māra.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ston pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ston pa'i tshe /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, when this profound perfection of wisdom is being taught,

original: bar chad du 'gyur ba'i bdud kyi las mang du 'byung ste /
analyzed: bar chad du 'gyur ba'i bdud kyi las mang du 'byung ste /
translated: many works of Māra arise as obstacles.

original: bdud kyi las de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud @362b kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bdud kyi las de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud @362b kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: Those works of Māra should be recognized by bodhisattva great beings as works of Māra.

original: rig par byas nas rnam par spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rig par byas nas rnam par spang bar bya'o //
translated: Having recognized them, they should be abandoned.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
translated: When this was said, the venerable Subhūti

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽bdud kyi las byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rig par bgyi ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / bdud kyi las byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rig par bgyi ste /
translated: “Lord,🔽what are the works of Māra that bodhisattva great beings should recognize

original: spang bar bgyi ba de dag gang lags /
analyzed: spang bar bgyi ba de dag gang lags /
translated: and abandon?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ni bdud kyi las /
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ni bdud kyi las /
translated: “Subhūti, a counterfeit perfection of wisdom is a work of Māra.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ni bdud kyi las te /🔽de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ni bdud kyi las te / de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya ste /
translated: the perfection of meditative stability, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of tolerance, the perfection of moral discipline, and the perfection of generosity.

original: rnam par spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par spang bar bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, these are the works of Māra that bodhisattva great beings should know and then give up.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang nyan thos kyi theg pa dang ldan pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i mdo sde dag kyang /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang nyan thos kyi theg pa dang ldan pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i mdo sde dag kyang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya ste /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the discourses of the Listeners’ Vehicle and the Solitary Realizers’ Vehicle

original: rnam par spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par spang bar bya'o //
translated: are also works of Māra that bodhisattva great beings should know and then give up.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang /🔽rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang @363a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang @363a *//
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, it is because the emptiness of internal phenomena, the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities, the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts,

original: chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa gang gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa gang gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: the four legs of miraculous power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven branches of enlightenment, the noble eightfold path, the four noble truths, and the gateways to liberation—emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness—are all empty of their own intrinsic nature.

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub 'thob par 'gyur ba de dag kyang /🔽bdud sdig to can dag dge slong gi cha byad du byas shing /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub 'thob par 'gyur ba de dag kyang / bdud sdig to can dag dge slong gi cha byad du byas shing /
translated: arhatship, and individual enlightenment,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la nye bar bsten te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la nye bar bsten te /
translated: and also Māra the wicked one, having approached bodhisattva great beings in the guise of a monk,

original: de'ang de la dga' ba skyed na /
analyzed: de'ang de la dga' ba skyed na /
translated: and also having generated delight in them,

original: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
translated: Subhūti, that is also a condition that is not conducive to this deep perfection of wisdom being written out, taken up, borne in mind,

original: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, that also should be known by bodhisattva great beings as the work of Māra.”🔽“Moreover, Subhūti, when this deep perfection of wisdom is being written out,

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang bdud sdig to can dag sangs rgyas kyi cha byad du lus gser gyi kha dog dang / mi chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / 'od 'dom gang bar ldan par byas shing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang bdud sdig to can dag sangs rgyas kyi cha byad du lus gser gyi kha dog dang / mi chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / 'od 'dom gang bar ldan par byas shing /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, Māra the wicked one, having transformed himself into the form of a Buddha, with a golden-colored body, the thirty-two marks of a great man, and a fathom-wide aura,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du 'ongs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du 'ongs te /
translated: approaches a bodhisattva great being

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mos pa skyed do //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mos pa skyed do //
translated: and generates devotion in him.

original: des mos pa bskyed nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las yongs su @363b nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des mos pa bskyed nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las yongs su @363b nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: Having generated devotion, he causes him to fall from the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
translated: Subhūti, this also is a condition that does not lead to the writing, the taking up, the reading, or the understanding of this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, this also should be known by the bodhisattva great beings as the work of Māra.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang bdud sdig to can dag rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de'i mdun du sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun nye bar ston to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang bdud sdig to can dag rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de'i mdun du sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun nye bar ston to //
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, Māra the wicked one will manifest a Buddha and a community of monks in front of that son of a good family or daughter of a good family.

original: des de la 'dod pa bskyed cing bdag kyang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'di lta bur shog cig /
analyzed: des de la 'dod pa bskyed cing bdag kyang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'di lta bur shog cig /
translated: He will generate desire for that, thinking, “In the future, may I also become a Tathāgata, an Arhat, a Perfectly Awakened One like this one.

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa 'dis tshogs yongs su bsdus pa de bzhin du bdag gis kyang /🔽tshogs yongs su bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa 'dis tshogs yongs su bsdus pa de bzhin du bdag gis kyang / tshogs yongs su bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: Just as this Tathāgata has gathered the community, I too will gather the community.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'di chos ji ltar ston pa de bzhin du bdag gis kyang chos bstan par bgyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'di chos ji ltar ston pa de bzhin du bdag gis kyang chos bstan par bgyi'o //
translated: Just as this Tathāgata teaches the Dharma, I too will teach the Dharma.

original: zhes de de la 'dod pa bskyed pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las yongs su nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes de de la 'dod pa bskyed pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las yongs su nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: ” Because he generates desire for that, he will fall away from the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste; rab 'byor /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste; rab 'byor /
translated: Subhūti, this also is a condition that prevents the writing out, the taking up, the studying, or the explaining of this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, this also should be known by the bodhisattva great beings as the work of Māra.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang bdud sdig to can dag byang chub sems dpa' brgya @364a *//🔽phrag du ma /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang bdud sdig to can dag byang chub sems dpa' brgya @364a *// phrag du ma /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the wicked Māra conjures up many hundreds of bodhisattvas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' stong phrag du ma /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' stong phrag du ma /
translated: many thousands of bodhisattvas,🔽many hundreds of thousands of bodhisattvas practicing the perfection of giving,

original: byang chub sems dpa' brgya stong phrag du ma sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' brgya stong phrag du ma sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de lta bu dag nye bar ston te /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de lta bu dag nye bar ston te /
translated: the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom.

original: de'ang byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa po de dag la 'dod pa skyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'ang byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa po de dag la 'dod pa skyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will arouse desire for those who are in the Bodhisattva Vehicle.

original: des de dag la 'dod pa bskyed nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las yongs su nyams par 'gyur te /🔽rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / sgom pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
analyzed: des de dag la 'dod pa bskyed nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las yongs su nyams par 'gyur te / rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / sgom pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
translated: Having aroused desire for them, they will fall away from the knowledge of all modes.🔽This also, Subhuti, is a deed of Mara, when the Bodhisattva who wants to copy out, etc. this deep perfection of wisdom, does not get the requisite conditions for copying it out, etc.🔽This also, Subhuti, is a deed of Mara, when the Bodhisattva who wants to copy out, etc. this deep perfection of wisdom, does not get the requisite conditions for copying it out, etc.🔽This also, Subhuti, is a deed of Mara, when the Bodhisattva who wants to copy out, etc. this deep perfection of wisdom, does not get the requisite conditions for copying it out, etc.

analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o; ;rab 'byor / de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la gzugs med do //🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa med do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la gzugs med do //🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa med do //
translated: This also, Subhuti, is a deed of Mara, when the Bodhisattva who wants to copy out, etc. this deep perfection of wisdom, does not get the requisite conditions for copying it out, etc.🔽This also, Subhuti, is a deed of Mara, when the Bodhisattva who wants to copy out, etc. this deep perfection of

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba med do //
translated: the sense fields, the elements, and dependent origination do not exist.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams med do //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams med do //
translated: The perfections do not exist.

original: stong pa nyid rnams med do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid rnams med do //
translated: Emptiness does not exist.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams med do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams med do //
translated: The dharmas on the side of awakening do not exist.

original: 'phags @364b pa'i bden pa rnams med do //
analyzed: 'phags @364b pa'i bden pa rnams med do //
translated: The noble truths do not exist.

original: bsam gtan rnams med do //
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams med do //
translated: The concentrations do not exist.

original: tshad med pa rnams med do //
analyzed: tshad med pa rnams med do //
translated: The immeasurables do not exist.

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams med do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams med do //
translated: The formless absorptions do not exist.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad med do //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad med do //
translated: The eight liberations do not exist.

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu med do //
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu med do //
translated: The nine serial absorptions do not exist.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa med do //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa med do //
translated: The emptiness gate of liberation, the signlessness gate of liberation, and the wishlessness gate of liberation do not exist.

original: mngon par shes pa rnams med do //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams med do //
translated: The clairvoyances do not exist.

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams med do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams med do //
translated: The meditative stabilities do not exist.

original: gzungs kyi sgo rnams med do //
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rnams med do //
translated: The dhāraṇī gateways do not exist.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu med do //
translated: The ten tathāgata powers do not exist.

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi med do //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi med do //
translated: The four fearlessnesses do not exist.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi med do //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi med do //
translated: The four detailed and thorough knowledges do not exist.

original: byams pa chen po med do //
analyzed: byams pa chen po med do //
translated: there is no great love,

original: snying rje chen po med do //
analyzed: snying rje chen po med do //
translated: there is no great compassion,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad med do //
translated: there are no eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu med do //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu med do //
translated: there is no result of stream enterer,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub med do //
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub med do //
translated: there is no result of once-returner, there is no result of non-returner, there is no state of a worthy one, there is no pratyekabuddha’s awakening,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub med do //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub med do //
translated: and there is no unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab 'byor / gang la gzugs med pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa med pa dang / skye mched med pa dang / khams med pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba med pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang la gzugs med pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa med pa dang / skye mched med pa dang / khams med pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba med pa dang /
translated: Subhūti, where there is no form, no feeling, no perception, no volitional factors, and no consciousness, no sense fields, no constituents, no dependent originations,

analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams med pa dang / stong pa nyid rnams med pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams med pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams med pa dang / bsam gtan rnams med pa dang / tshad med pa rnams med @365a *// pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams med pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad med pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu med pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: the perfections do not exist, the emptinesses do not exist, the dharmas on the side of awakening do not exist, the noble truths do not exist, the meditative stabilizations do not exist, the immeasurable meditative stabilizations do not exist,🔽the formless meditative stabilizations do not exist, the eight deliverances do not exist, the nine serial meditative stabilizations do not exist, the emptiness, signless, and wishless gateways to liberation do not exist,

translated: the clairvoyances do not exist, the meditative stabilizations do not exist, the dhāraṇī gateways do not exist, the powers of the tathāgatas do not exist, the fearlessnesses do not exist,
