original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri pa dang / klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa @365b dang / ston pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa de dag la'ang bar chad du 'gyur ba mang ngo //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri pa dang / klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa @365b dang / ston pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa de dag la'ang bar chad du 'gyur ba mang ngo //
translated: “Subhūti, there are many obstacles for those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family who write out this deep perfection of wisdom, read it aloud, bear it in mind, recite it, teach it, and properly pay attention to it.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / 'dzambu'i gling 'di'i rin po che gser dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'urya dang / dung dang / man shel dang / byi ru dang / dngul dang / sa le sbram gang ji snyed cig yod pa dag ni bar chad du 'gyur ba mang zhing /
analyzed: dper na / 'dzambu'i gling 'di'i rin po che gser dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'urya dang / dung dang / man shel dang / byi ru dang / dngul dang / sa le sbram gang ji snyed cig yod pa dag ni bar chad du 'gyur ba mang zhing /
translated: all the jewels in this Rose Apple Continent—gold, jewels, pearls, beryl, conch shells, crystals, corals, silver, and refined gold—have many obstacles and

original: phyir rgol ba mang ba dag go /
analyzed: phyir rgol ba mang ba dag go /
translated: have many adversaries.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / ston pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa de dag la'ang bdud kyi las mang po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / ston pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa de dag la'ang bdud kyi las mang po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, many a deed of Māra will occur to those sons and daughters of good family who copy out this deep perfection of wisdom, and who read it aloud, and who learn it, and who teach it, and who recite it, and who properly pay attention to it.

original: bar chad mang po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bar chad mang po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Many an obstacle will occur.

original: phyi rgol ba mang po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi rgol ba mang po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Many a hostile force will occur.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: de ni de bzhin no //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin no //
translated: it is so.

original: bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: Well-Gone One,

original: de ni de bzhin te /
analyzed: de ni de bzhin te /
translated: it is so.

original: 'dzambu'i gling 'di'i rin po che gser dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'urya dang / dung dang / man shel dang / byi ru dang / dngul dang / sa le sbram gang ji snyed cig mchis pa de dag ni bar chad du 'gyur ba mang zhing slar rgol ba mang pa lags so //
analyzed: 'dzambu'i gling 'di'i rin po che gser dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'urya dang / dung dang / man shel dang / byi ru dang / dngul dang / sa le sbram gang ji snyed cig mchis pa de dag ni bar chad du 'gyur ba mang zhing slar rgol ba mang pa lags so //
translated: Whatever precious things there are in this Rose Apple Continent, such as gold, jewels, pearls, beryl, conch shells, crystals, corals, silver, and copper, they are subject to many obstacles and have many adversaries.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de bzhin du rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton bgyid pa dang / ston pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid pa de dag la'ang @366a *//
analyzed: de bzhin du rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton bgyid pa dang / ston pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid pa de dag la'ang @366a *//
translated: in the same way, for those sons of good family or daughters of good family who write out this profound perfection of wisdom, and read it aloud, and bear it in mind, and recite it, and teach it, and properly pay attention to it,

original: bdud kyi las mang po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽bar chad mang po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdud kyi las mang po 'byung bar 'gyur ro // bar chad mang po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: many works of Māra will occur.🔽Many obstacles will occur.

original: slar rgol ba mang po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slar rgol ba mang po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Many adversaries will occur.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: skyes bu glen pa gang rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton bgyid pa dang / ston pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid pa dag gi bar chad bgyid pa ni bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa ste /
analyzed: skyes bu glen pa gang rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton bgyid pa dang / ston pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid pa dag gi bar chad bgyid pa ni bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa ste /
translated: Blessed One, those foolish people who create obstacles for sons of good family and daughters of good family who write out, read aloud, clearly articulate, teach, and properly pay attention to this deep perfection of wisdom are inspired by Māra.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: skyes bu glen pa de dag ni blo chung zhing blo zhan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu glen pa de dag ni blo chung zhing blo zhan par 'gyur ro //
translated: those foolish people will have little intelligence and weak intelligence.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: skyes bu glen pa gang rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton bgyid pa dang; ston pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid pa de dag gi bar chad bgyid pa de dag ni /
analyzed: skyes bu glen pa gang rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton bgyid pa dang; ston pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid pa de dag gi bar chad bgyid pa de dag ni /
translated: those foolish people who create obstacles for sons of good family and daughters of good family who write out, read aloud, clearly articulate, teach, and properly pay attention to this deep perfection of wisdom

original: blo rgya shin tu chung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: blo rgya shin tu chung bar 'gyur te /
translated: will have very little intelligence.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rlabs po che dag la de dag gi sems mi 'jug go /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rlabs po che dag la de dag gi sems mi 'jug go /
translated: their minds do not engage with the vast teachings of the Buddha.

original: de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di mi 'dri /
analyzed: de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di mi 'dri /
translated: They do not ask questions about this profound perfection of wisdom,

original: mi klog / lung mi 'bog /
analyzed: mi klog / lung mi 'bog /
translated: they do not read it, they do not receive it,

original: kha ton mi bgyid /
analyzed: kha ton mi bgyid /
translated: they do not recite it,

original: mi sgom / tshul bzhin du yid la mi bgyid de /
analyzed: mi sgom / tshul bzhin du yid la mi bgyid de /
translated: they do not meditate on it, and they do not properly pay attention to it.

original: gzhan 'dri zhing klog pa dang / kha ton bgyid pa dang / ston pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid pa dag la'ang bar chad bgyid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan 'dri zhing klog pa dang / kha ton bgyid pa dang / ston pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid pa dag la'ang bar chad bgyid par 'gyur ro //
translated: They also create obstacles for others who ask questions about it, read it, recite it, teach it, and properly pay attention to it.”🔽The Blessed One said,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab @366b 'byor /🔽de de bzhin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab @366b 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti,🔽it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said!

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di mi 'dri /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di mi 'dri /
translated: Those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage who do not ask questions about this profound perfection of wisdom,

original: mi klog / lung mi 'bog /
analyzed: mi klog / lung mi 'bog /
translated: who do not read it, who do not receive it,

original: kha ton mi byed /
analyzed: kha ton mi byed /
translated: who do not recite it,

original: mi sgom / tshul bzhin du yid la mi byed cing /
analyzed: mi sgom / tshul bzhin du yid la mi byed cing /
translated: who do not meditate on it, and who do not properly pay attention to it,

original: gzhan 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / ston pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa de dag gi bar chad byed pa de dag ni bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa /
analyzed: gzhan 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / ston pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa de dag gi bar chad byed pa de dag ni bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa /
translated: They will be possessed by Māra,

original: theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa /
analyzed: theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa /
translated: they will be newly entered into the vehicle,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa /
translated: they will not have planted the roots of virtue,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu chung ba /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu chung ba /
translated: they will have very few roots of virtue,

original: sngon gyi rgyal ba la dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsgrubs pa /
analyzed: sngon gyi rgyal ba la dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsgrubs pa /
translated: they will not have served the victors of the past,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su ma zin pa dag ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su ma zin pa dag ste /
translated: and they will not be assisted by spiritual friends.

original: rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni blo chung zhing blo zhan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni blo chung zhing blo zhan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage will be of little intelligence and feeble intelligence.

original: rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di mi 'dri; mi klog /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di mi 'dri; mi klog /
translated: Those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage who do not ask questions about this perfection of wisdom, who do not read it aloud,🔽who do not receive it,

original: lung mi 'bog /🔽kha ton mi byed /
analyzed: lung mi 'bog / kha ton mi byed /
translated: who do not recite it,

original: mi sgom / tshul bzhin du yid la mi byed cing /
analyzed: mi sgom / tshul bzhin du yid la mi byed cing /
translated: who do not meditate on it, and who do not properly pay attention to it,

original: gzhan 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / ston pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed ba de dag gi bar chad byed pa de dag ni blo rgya shin tu chung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / ston pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed ba de dag gi bar chad byed pa de dag ni blo rgya shin tu chung bar 'gyur te /
translated: They will be very limited in their understanding,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rlabs po che dag la de dag gi sems mi 'jug go /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rlabs po che dag la de dag gi sems mi 'jug go /
translated: and their minds will not engage with the vast teachings of the Buddha.

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / ston pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dag la bdud kyi las 'di dag 'byung mod kyi /🔽'on kyang / @367a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / ston pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dag la bdud kyi las 'di dag 'byung mod kyi / 'on kyang / @367a *//
translated: “Subhūti, these are the works of Māra that occur when this profound perfection of wisdom is being taught, when it is being read aloud, when it is being taken up, when it is being borne in mind, when it is being recited, when it is being expounded, and when it is being properly paid attention to.

original: rab 'byor / rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri zhing klog pa dang / lung 'bog cing kha ton byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed cing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri zhing klog pa dang / lung 'bog cing kha ton byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed cing /
translated: “Subhūti, when sons of noble family and daughters of noble family write out this profound perfection of wisdom, read it aloud, take it up, bear it in mind, recite it, expound it, and properly pay attention to it,

original: gong du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang /
analyzed: gong du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang /
translated: the perfection of diligence, the perfection of patience, the perfection of discipline, and the perfection of generosity.

original: stong pa nyid thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang /
translated: It is to perfect all the aspects of emptiness, to perfect the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment, and to perfect the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables,

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang /
translated: the formless absorptions, the eight aspects of liberation, the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness,🔽the forms of higher knowing,

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang /
translated: the dhāraṇī gateways, the powers of the tathāgatas, the forms of fearlessness, the detailed and thorough knowledges, great compassion, and the distinct attributes of a buddha,🔽and the perfection of the knowledge of all aspects,

original: thams cad shes pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / lam @367b gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed na /
analyzed: thams cad shes pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / lam @367b gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed na /
translated: the knowledge of the aspects of the path, and omniscience.

original: rab 'byor / de ni sangs rgyas kyi mthu yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni sangs rgyas kyi mthu yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: “Subhūti, you should know that this is the power of the Buddha.

original: des rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri'o //
analyzed: des rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri'o //
translated: It is because of that that those sons of a good family and daughters of a good family write out this deep perfection of wisdom,

original: klog go / lung 'bog go /
analyzed: klog go / lung 'bog go /
translated: recite it, take it up,

original: kha ton byed do //
analyzed: kha ton byed do //
translated: and chant it.

original: tshul bzhin du yid la byed do //
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la byed do //
translated: They properly pay attention to it

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: and complete just this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: gong du pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: gong du pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: They complete all the perfections above that.

original: stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang /
translated: They complete all the emptinesses, the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the four noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the eight deliverances,

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang /
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang /
translated: the clairvoyances,🔽the meditative stabilizations,🔽the dhāraṇī gateways,🔽the powers of the tathāgatas,🔽the fearlessnesses,🔽the detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.🔽They complete the knowledge of paths.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: They complete the knowledge of all aspects.

original: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig @368a *//
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig @368a *//
translated: The lord buddhas in the ten directions

original: bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba de dag kyang /
analyzed: bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba de dag kyang /
translated: who are present,

original: rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo de dag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton bya ba dang / bstan pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bya ba'i phyir dgongs pa mdzad do //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo de dag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton bya ba dang / bstan pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bya ba'i phyir dgongs pa mdzad do //
translated: They are intent on those sons of a good family and those daughters of a good family who write out this perfection of wisdom, take it up, preserve it, recite it, study it, and properly pay attention to it.

original: phyogs bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyir mi ldog pa gang ji snyed pa de dag kyang rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dri zhing klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang /🔽kha ton byed pa dang / ston pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa de dag gi don du brtson par byed cing /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyir mi ldog pa gang ji snyed pa de dag kyang rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dri zhing klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / ston pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa de dag gi don du brtson par byed cing /
translated: And all the irreversible bodhisattva great beings in the ten directions are intent on those sons of a good family and those daughters of a good family who write out this perfection of wisdom, take it up, preserve it, recite it,🔽study it, and properly pay attention to it.

original: yongs su 'dzin par byed do ////
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin par byed do ////
translated: They are intent on them and they are intent on protecting them.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-five Thousand Lines

original: bam po bzhi bcu lnga pa /
analyzed: bam po bzhi bcu lnga pa /
translated: The Fourth Fifty

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this.

original: dper na / bud med la la zhig la bu lnga'am /🔽bcu'am / nyi shu'am /
analyzed: dper na / bud med la la zhig la bu lnga'am / bcu'am / nyi shu'am /
translated: For example, a woman may have five sons,

original: sum cu'am / bzhi bcu'am /
analyzed: sum cu'am / bzhi bcu'am /
translated: or ten, twenty, thirty, forty,

original: lnga bcu'am / brgya'am /
analyzed: lnga bcu'am / brgya'am /
translated: fifty, a hundred,

original: stong zhig yod na /
analyzed: stong zhig yod na /
translated: or a thousand sons.

original: de dag ni ma de ci nas kyang mi na bar bya ba'i phyir brtson par byed cing /
analyzed: de dag ni ma de ci nas kyang mi na bar bya ba'i phyir brtson par byed cing /
translated: Those sons would strive to ensure that their mother would not be ill.

original: bdag cag gi ma 'di ji ltar na nad med par 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag cag gi ma 'di ji ltar na nad med par 'gyur /
translated: “How can we ensure that our mother is not ill?

original: bdag cag gi ma 'di la ji ltar na bar chad du mi 'gyur /🔽bdag cag gi ma 'di ji ltar na yun ring du 'tsho bar 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag cag gi ma 'di la ji ltar na bar chad du mi 'gyur / bdag cag gi ma 'di ji ltar na yun ring du 'tsho bar 'gyur /
translated: How can we ensure that our mother does not have any obstacles?🔽How can we ensure that our mother lives a long time?

original: bdag cag gi ma 'di ring du 'tsho bar byed na ji ltar bya /
analyzed: bdag cag gi ma 'di ring du 'tsho bar byed na ji ltar bya /
translated: What can we do to ensure that our mother lives a long time?

original: bdag cag gi ma 'di lus la mi bde ba'i nyams @368b med par bya na ji ltar bya /
analyzed: bdag cag gi ma 'di lus la mi bde ba'i nyams @368b med par bya na ji ltar bya /
translated: What can we do to ensure that our mother’s body is not uncomfortable?

original: 'di ni bdag cag gi skyed bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni bdag cag gi skyed bskyed pa ste /
translated: She is the one who gave birth to us,

original: srog gi sbyin bdag go /
analyzed: srog gi sbyin bdag go /
translated: and she is the one who gave us life.”

original: zhes de dag ma de la rim gro legs par bya bas rim gro byed do //
analyzed: zhes de dag ma de la rim gro legs par bya bas rim gro byed do //
translated: They would serve their mother well with proper service.

original: de dag ni 'di'i srog gi bar chad du 'gyur du 'ong ngo //
analyzed: de dag ni 'di'i srog gi bar chad du 'gyur du 'ong ngo //
translated: “It would be terrible if there were obstacles to her life!”

original: lus nyam chung bar 'gyur du 'ong ngo //
analyzed: lus nyam chung bar 'gyur du 'ong ngo //
translated: “They will become weak in body.”

original: lus la sha sbrang dang / sbrang bu dang / sprul gyis gtse ba'i mi bde bas bab tu 'ong ngo //
analyzed: lus la sha sbrang dang / sbrang bu dang / sprul gyis gtse ba'i mi bde bas bab tu 'ong ngo //
translated: “They will be bothered by the discomfort of being bitten by flies, mosquitoes, and snakes.”

original: tsha ba dang / grang ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pas mi bde bar 'gyur du 'ong ngo //
analyzed: tsha ba dang / grang ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pas mi bde bar 'gyur du 'ong ngo //
translated: “They will be bothered by the discomfort of heat, cold, hunger, and thirst.”

original: zhes bsti stang legs par bya bas bsti stang du byed do //
analyzed: zhes bsti stang legs par bya bas bsti stang du byed do //
translated: In this way, they will honor them with the highest honors.

original: de ltar bu de dag ma de la 'di ni bdag cag skyed bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar bu de dag ma de la 'di ni bdag cag skyed bskyed pa'o //
translated: “These are the ones who gave birth to us.

original: 'di ni 'jig rten 'di ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten 'di ston pa'o //
translated: They are the ones who showed us this world.”

original: zhes bde ba'i yo byad thams cad kyis rgyun du rim gro byed cing /
analyzed: zhes bde ba'i yo byad thams cad kyis rgyun du rim gro byed cing /
translated: In this way, they will always serve them with all the necessities of happiness.

original: bsti stang dang bkur sti cher byed do //
analyzed: bsti stang dang bkur sti cher byed do //
translated: They will honor and respect them greatly.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyang /
translated: “Subhūti, in the same way, the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis rtag tu rgyun mi chad par gzigs shing dgongs te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis rtag tu rgyun mi chad par gzigs shing dgongs te /
translated: The Buddha always sees and considers this profound perfection of wisdom with the eye of the Buddha.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni bdag cag gi sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad skyed bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni bdag cag gi sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad skyed bskyed pa'o //
translated: This perfection of wisdom has produced all our buddhadharmas.

original: 'jig rten 'di ston ston pa'o zhes rgyun du gzigs shing dgongs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di ston ston pa'o zhes rgyun du gzigs shing dgongs so //
translated: It has shown this world again and again.’

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na /
translated: In the world systems of the ten directions, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river,🔽there are as many tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly awakened buddhas as there are sand particles in the Ganges river.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba @369a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba @369a *//
translated: Those lord buddhas, who are alive, live on, and maintain themselves,

original: dang; chos ston pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang /
analyzed: dang; chos ston pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang /
translated: and who teach the Dharma,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis rtag tu rgyun mi chad par gzigs shing dgongs so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis rtag tu rgyun mi chad par gzigs shing dgongs so //
translated: This profound perfection of wisdom is always and uninterruptedly seen and contemplated with the Buddha-eye.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams skyed bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams skyed bskyed pa'o //
translated: This is what gives birth to the tathāgatas, arhats, genuinely perfect buddhas.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes 'di'ang ston ston pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes 'di'ang ston ston pa'o //
translated: This is what teaches and demonstrates the gnosis of omniscience.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis rtag tu rgyun mi chad par gzigs shing dgongs so //
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis rtag tu rgyun mi chad par gzigs shing dgongs so //
translated: Therefore, the tathāgatas, arhats, genuinely perfect buddhas always and uninterruptedly see and contemplate this profound perfection of wisdom with the Buddha-eye.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di las byung ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /🔽tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di las byung ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: the perfection of morality, and the perfection of generosity of the Tathagatas, the Saints, the Perfectly Enlightened Ones.

original: 'di las byung ba ni nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ro //
analyzed: 'di las byung ba ni nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ro //
translated: From this arises the emptiness of internal phenomena, the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.

original: 'di las byung ba ni dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam @369b yan lag brgyad pa'o //🔽'di las byung ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad do //
analyzed: 'di las byung ba ni dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam @369b yan lag brgyad pa'o // 'di las byung ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad do //
translated: From it arise the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four legs of supernatural power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven factors of awakening, and the eightfold noble path.🔽From it arise the noble truths, the meditative stabilizations, the immeasurables, the formless meditative attainments, and the eight liberations.

original: 'di las byung ba ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang /
analyzed: 'di las byung ba ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang /
translated: From it arise the nine serial meditative attainments, the emptiness gate of liberation, the signlessness gate of liberation, the wishlessness gate of liberation, the superknowledges, the meditative stabilizations,

original: gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ro //
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ro //
translated: the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, great compassion, the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas, up to and the knowledge of all aspects.

original: 'di las byung ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa rnams dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams dang; phyir mi 'ong ba rnams dang / dgra bcom pa rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams te /
analyzed: 'di las byung ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa rnams dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams dang; phyir mi 'ong ba rnams dang / dgra bcom pa rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams te /
translated: “The stream enterers, the once-returners, the non-returners, the arhats, the pratyekabuddhas, the bodhisattvas, and the tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas have come from this.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang /🔽mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba de dag thams cad ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo @370a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang / mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba de dag thams cad ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo @370a *//
translated: “Subhūti, all those Tathāgatas, Arhats, and Perfectly Awakened Ones who have fully awakened, are fully awakening, and will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: 'di la brten te /🔽bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //🔽mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: 'di la brten te / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so // mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: they all do so in dependence on this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They have fully awakened, are fully awakening, and will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri zhing klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / bsgom pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa de dag thams cad kyang /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis /🔽sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis rtag tu rgyun mi chad par gzigs shing dgongs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri zhing klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / bsgom pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa de dag thams cad kyang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis / sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis rtag tu rgyun mi chad par gzigs shing dgongs so //
translated: “Subhūti, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha always sees and considers with his buddha eye all those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage in the vehicle of the bodhisattvas who write out, read aloud, clearly articulate, and contemplate this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom, and who practice it in the correct manner.🔽The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha always sees and considers with his buddha eye all those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage in the vehicle of the bodhisattvas who write out, read aloud, clearly articulate, and contemplate this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom, and who practice it in the correct manner.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag la ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ci nas kyang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag la ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ci nas kyang /
translated: Subhūti, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha always sees and considers with his buddha eye all those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage in the vehicle of the bodhisattvas who write out, read aloud, clearly articulate, and contemplate this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom, and who practice it in the correct manner.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur bar rtag tu rgyun mi chad par srung ba mdzad do //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur bar rtag tu rgyun mi chad par srung ba mdzad do //
translated: they will not regress from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and they will always, constantly be guarded.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang 'di skad du /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang 'di skad du /
translated: “Blessed One, you have said,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams bskyed pa'o //
translated: ‘The perfection of wisdom gives birth to the tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten sten pa'o zhes bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten sten pa'o zhes bka' stsal pa /
translated: The perfection of wisdom teaches the world.’

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ji ltar na @370b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams bskyed pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na @370b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams bskyed pa lags /
translated: how does the perfection of wisdom give birth to the tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten ston pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten ston pa lags /
translated: how does the perfection of wisdom teach the world?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol phyin pas de bzhin gshegs pa bskrun pa lags /🔽'jig rten ni de bzhin gshegs pas gang la gsungs bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol phyin pas de bzhin gshegs pa bskrun pa lags / 'jig rten ni de bzhin gshegs pas gang la gsungs bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: How does the perfection of wisdom produce the Tathagata?

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu bskyed do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu bskyed do //
translated: The Lord: This perfection of wisdom, Subhuti, produces the ten powers of a Tathagata,

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du bskyed do //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du bskyed do //
translated: his four grounds of self-confidence, his four analytical knowledges, his great friendliness, his great compassion, his eighteen special attributes of a Buddha, up to the knowledge of all modes.

original: rab 'byor chos de dag gis ni de bzhin gshegs par brjod de /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos de dag gis ni de bzhin gshegs par brjod de /
translated: By these dharmas, Subhuti, the Tathagata is so called.

original: rab 'byor / de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed do //
translated: Therefore, Subhuti, this perfection of wisdom produces the Tathagata.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The Lord: So it is, Subhuti.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i 'jig rten gang lags /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i 'jig rten gang lags /
translated: “What is the world taught by the Tathāgata?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / phung po lnga ni de bzhin gshegs pas 'jig rten du gsungs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor / phung po lnga ni de bzhin gshegs pas 'jig rten du gsungs so //
translated: “Subhūti, the Tathāgata has taught the five aggregates as the world.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Blessed One,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mos phung po lnga ni ji ltar bstan pa lags /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mos phung po lnga ni ji ltar bstan pa lags /
translated: how are the five aggregates taught by the profound perfection of wisdom?”

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ji ltar phung po lnga ston pa lags /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ji ltar phung po lnga ston pa lags /
translated: “How does the perfection of wisdom teach the five aggregates?”

original: @371a *// bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: @371a *// bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni phung po lnga po 'di dag 'jig par ston pa ma yin /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni phung po lnga po 'di dag 'jig par ston pa ma yin /
translated: “The perfection of wisdom does not teach the destruction of these five aggregates,

original: rab tu 'jig par ston pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rab tu 'jig par ston pa ma yin te /
translated: nor does it teach their complete destruction.

original: skye zhes bya bar mi ston to //
analyzed: skye zhes bya bar mi ston to //
translated: It does not teach ‘arising.’

original: 'gag ces bya bar mi ston to //
analyzed: 'gag ces bya bar mi ston to //
translated: It does not teach ‘cessation.’

original: kun nas nyon mongs zhes bya ba dang / rnam par byang zhes bya ba dang / 'phel zhes bya ba dang / 'grib ces bya ba dang / blang zhes bya ba dang / dor zhes bya ba dang / 'das zhes bya ba dang / ma 'ongs zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs zhes bya ba dang / rnam par byang zhes bya ba dang / 'phel zhes bya ba dang / 'grib ces bya ba dang / blang zhes bya ba dang / dor zhes bya ba dang / 'das zhes bya ba dang / ma 'ongs zhes bya ba dang /
translated: “afflictive” and “purified,” “increase” and “decrease,” “adopt” and “abandon,” “past” and “future,”🔽

original: da ltar byung zhes bya bar mi ston to //
analyzed: da ltar byung zhes bya bar mi ston to //
translated: He does not teach that there is defilement or purification, increase or decrease, taking up or putting down, past, future, or present.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽stong pa nyid la 'jig pa'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / stong pa nyid la 'jig pa'am /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab tu 'jig pa med do;/🔽mtshan ma med pa la 'jig pa'am /
analyzed: rab tu 'jig pa med do;/ mtshan ma med pa la 'jig pa'am /
translated: Emptiness does not break down or completely break down.

analyzed: rab tu 'jig pa med do // smon pa med pa la 'jig pa'am /

analyzed: rab tu 'jig pa med do // mngon par 'du bya ba med pa la 'jig pa'am /

analyzed: rab tu 'jig pa med do // skye ba med pa la 'jig pa'am /

analyzed: rab tu 'jig pa med do // dngos po med pa la 'jig pa'am /

analyzed: rab tu 'jig pa med do // rang bzhin med pa la 'jig pa'am /

original: rab tu 'jig pa med do //
analyzed: rab tu 'jig pa med do //
translated: Naturelessness does not break down or completely break down.

analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten ston par gsungs te /
translated: “Subhūti, the Tathāgata teaches the world by means of the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: rab 'byor / sems can tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa'i sems dang spyod pa mkhyen pa de dag kyang /

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid la brten cing rab tu mkhyen te /

analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la ni sems can med do //

analyzed: gzugs su gdags pa mi dmigs so //

analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa med do //

analyzed: rnam par shes par gdags pa mi dmigs so //

original: mig med do //
analyzed: mig med do //

original: gzugs med do //
analyzed: gzugs med do //

analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams med do //

analyzed: snying rje chen po med do //

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams med do //
translated: the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha do not exist, up to

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du med do //

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du gdags pa mi dmigs so //

analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi 'jig rten ston pa yin te /
translated: is the Tathāgata’s teacher of the world.

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni gzugs ston par byed pa ma yin no //

analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ston par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: does not show feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness,

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du ston par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: up to does not show the knowledge of all aspects.

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang /

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyid la med cing mi @372b dmigs na / gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa yod pa'am /
translated: does not exist and is not apprehended in this deep perfection of wisdom.🔽How could form,🔽feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness

analyzed: dmigs par lta ga la 'gyur / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yod pa'am /
translated: exist or be apprehended?🔽How could , up to and including omniscience,

analyzed: dmigs par lta ga la 'gyur /
translated: exist or be apprehended?

analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang sems can ji snyed cig gdags su yod pa /

analyzed: gzugs yod pa'am /

analyzed: gzugs med pa'am /

analyzed: 'du shes yod pa'am /

analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams 'di dang / phyogs bcu kun gyi 'jig rten gyi khams dag gi'ang rung ste /
translated: or in all the world systems in the ten directions,

analyzed: de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang / spros pa de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas sems bsdus pa dang / spros par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata knows just as it is the minds of those beings that are concentrated and distracted.

original: rab 'byor / ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pas sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang / spros pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pas sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang / spros pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “Subhūti, how does the Tathāgata know just as it is the minds of those beings that are concentrated and distracted?

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pas sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang / spros pa ni chos nyid kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pas sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang / spros pa ni chos nyid kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Subhūti, the Tathāgata knows just as it is the minds of those beings that are concentrated and distracted through the true nature of dharmas.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ” “Lord,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang / spros pa chos nyid gang gis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang / spros pa chos nyid gang gis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen /
translated: through what true nature of dharmas does the Tathāgata know just as it is the minds of those beings that are concentrated and distracted?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,🔽“Subhūti, the Tathāgata knows just as it is the minds of those beings that are concentrated and distracted through the true nature of dharmas that is empty of beings, that is empty of a person, that is empty of a living being, that is empty of one who lives, that is empty of one who does, that is empty of one who causes, that is empty of one who feels, that is empty of one who knows, and that is empty of one who sees.

original: rab 'byor / de ni chos nyid gang la chos nyid kyang mi dmigs na sems bsdus pa dang / spros pa lta @373a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni chos nyid gang la chos nyid kyang mi dmigs na sems bsdus pa dang / spros pa lta @373a *//
translated: The Suchness of the Suchness of all dharmas is the Suchness of the Suchness of form, etc.🔽The Suchness of the Suchness of form, etc. is the Suchness of the Suchness of the five skandhas.🔽The Suchness of the Suchness of the five skandhas is the Suchness of the Suchness of the Bodhisattvas, and the Suchness of the Suchness of the Bodhisattvas is the Suchness of the Suchness of all dharmas.

original: smos kyang mi smos pa'i chos nyid des /
analyzed: smos kyang mi smos pa'i chos nyid des /
translated: The Suchness of the Suchness of all dharmas is the Suchness of the Suchness of the Suchness of all dharmas.🔽The Suchness of the Suchness of the Suchness of all dharmas is the Suchness of the Suchness of the Suchness of form, etc.🔽The Suchness of the Suchness of the Suchness of form, etc. is the Suchness of the Suchness of the Suchness of the five skandhas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang / spros pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to; rab 'byor /🔽gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang / spros pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to; rab 'byor / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis /
translated: The Suchness of the Suchness of the Suchness of the five skandhas is the Suchness of the Suchness of the Suchness of the Bodhisattvas, and the Suchness of the Suchness of the Suchness of the Bodhisattvas is the Suchness of the Suchness of the Suchness of all dharmas.🔽The Suchness of the Suchness of the Suchness of all dharmas is the Suchness of the Suchness of the Suchness of the Suchness of all dharmas.

original: sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang / spros pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang / spros pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: The Suchness of the Suchness of the Suchness of the Suchness of all dharmas is the Suchness of the Suchness of the Suchness of the Suchness of form, etc.🔽The Suchness of the Suchness of the Suchness of the Suchness of form, etc. is the Suchness of the Suchness of the Suchness of the Suchness of the five skandhas.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis /🔽sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang / spros pa de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis /🔽sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang / spros pa de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: The Suchness of the Suchness of the Suchness of the Suchness of the five skandhas is the Suchness

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis /
translated: Subhuti, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One,

original: sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang; spros pa ni zad pa'i rnam par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang; spros pa ni zad pa'i rnam par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: knows the minds of those beings, which are contracted and distracted, as they really are, in their extinction.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis /
translated: Subhuti, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One,

original: sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang / spros pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gag pa dang / spong ba'i rnam par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang / spros pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gag pa dang / spong ba'i rnam par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: knows the minds of those beings, which are contracted and distracted, as they really are, in their separation, cessation, and abandonment.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis /
translated: Subhuti, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One,

original: sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang / spros pa ni zhi ba dang / dben pa'i rnam par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu @373b mkhyen to //
analyzed: sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang / spros pa ni zhi ba dang / dben pa'i rnam par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu @373b mkhyen to //
translated: knows the minds of those beings, which are contracted and distracted, as they really are, in their peacefulness and seclusion.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang / spros pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang / spros pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: In this way, Subhūti, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, knows the minds of those beings, their contraction and their expansion, just as they are.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One,

original: sems can de dag gi sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa la /
analyzed: sems can de dag gi sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa la /
translated: in those beings, knows a mind with attachment

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: as a mind with attachment, just as it is.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems la /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems la /

analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab mkhyen to //
translated: he knows it as a mind without attachment, just as it is.

original: zhe sdang dang bcas pa'i sems la /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang bcas pa'i sems la /
translated: In a mind with aversion,

original: zhe sdang dang bcas pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang bcas pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: he knows it as a mind with aversion, just as it is.

original: zhe sdang dang bral ba'i sems la /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang bral ba'i sems la /
translated: “A mind free from hatred

original: zhe sdang bral ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: zhe sdang bral ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: is known as a mind free from hatred.

original: gti mug dang bcas pa'i sems la /
analyzed: gti mug dang bcas pa'i sems la /

analyzed: gti mug dang bcas pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: is known as a mind with delusion.

original: gti mug dang bral ba'i sems la /
analyzed: gti mug dang bral ba'i sems la /
translated: “A mind free from delusion

original: gti mug dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: gti mug dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: is known as a mind free from delusion.🔽”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

analyzed: ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis /
translated: how is it that the thus-gone, worthy, perfect Buddha

analyzed: sems can de dag gi sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa la /
translated: knows that the minds of those beings that are associated with desire

analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems @374a *//🔽zhes bgyi bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen pa lags /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

translated: “Su­bhūti, a mind that is associated with desire is not the real nature of the mind.

analyzed: gti mug dang bral ba'i sems dmigs pa lta ci zhig smos /
translated: a mind without delusion be apprehended?

analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten te /

translated: He knows as it really is that the mind of those beings that is associated with passion is a mind associated with passion.

analyzed: zhe sdang dang bcas pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to // gti mug dang bcas pa'i sems la /
translated: He knows as it really is that the mind of those beings that is associated with aversion is a mind associated with aversion.

original: gti mug dang bcas pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //🔽rab 'byor / ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pas sems can de dag gi sems 'dod chags dang bral ba la /
analyzed: gti mug dang bcas pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to // rab 'byor / ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pas sems can de dag gi sems 'dod chags dang bral ba la /
translated: He knows as it really is that the mind of those beings that is associated with confusion is a mind associated with confusion.🔽He knows as it really is that the mind of those beings that is free from passion is a mind free from passion.🔽He knows as it really is that the mind of those beings that is free from aversion is a mind free from aversion.🔽He knows as it really is that the mind of those beings that is free from confusion is a mind free from confusion.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen ce na /🔽rab 'byor / sems 'dod chags dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen ce na / rab 'byor / sems 'dod chags dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Subhūti, how does the Tathāgata know as it really is that the mind of those beings that is free from passion is a mind free from passion?

original: sems kyi 'dod chags dang bcas pa nyid ma yin /
analyzed: sems kyi 'dod chags dang bcas pa nyid ma yin /
translated: Subhūti, that mind that is free from passion is not the passion of the mind.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: but it is not free from desire.

translated: Subhūti, two minds do not meet and join.🔽Subhūti, the Tathāgata, having known thus,

analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pas sems can de dag gi sems 'dod chags dang bral pa la /
translated: knows as it really is that the mind of those sentient beings is free from desire,

analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to // rab 'byor / ji ltar na sems can de dag gi sems zhe sdang dang bral ba la / zhe sdang @375a *//
translated: and that it is a mind free from desire.🔽“Subhūti, how does he know as it really is that the mind of those sentient beings is free from hatred,

analyzed: dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: and that it is a mind free from hatred?

original: rab 'byor / sems zhe sdang dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sems zhe sdang dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Subhūti, that mind which is free from hatred

analyzed: sems kyi zhe sdang dang bcas pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: is not a mind that has hatred,

original: zhe sdang dang bral ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang bral ba nyid ma yin no //

analyzed: rab 'byor / sems gnyis 'grogs shing phrad pa med de /
translated: Subhūti, two minds do not meet and join.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pas sems can de dag gi sems zhe sdang dang bral ba la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pas sems can de dag gi sems zhe sdang dang bral ba la /
translated: Subhūti, the Tathāgata, by means of this cognition of the way things really are, knows the minds of those sentient beings that are free from anger,

analyzed: zhe sdang dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: as minds that are free from anger, just as they are, in their suchness.

analyzed: rab 'byor / ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pas sems can de dag gi sems gti mug dang bral ba la /

analyzed: gti mug dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: as minds that are free from delusion, just as they are, in their suchness?

analyzed: rab 'byor / sems gti mug dang bral ba de ni / sems kyi gti mug dang bcas pa nyid ma yin /

analyzed: rab 'byor / sems gnyis 'grogs shing phrad pa med de /
translated: Subhūti, two minds do not meet and join.

analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pas sems can de dag gi sems gti mug dang bral ba la /
translated: Subhūti, the Tathāgata, by means of this cognition of the way things really are, knows the minds of those sentient beings that are free from delusion,

analyzed: gti mug dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows just as it is the mind that is free from delusion.

translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the tathāgatas, relying on this deep perfection of wisdom,🔽know just as it is the vast mind of other beings, of other persons.

analyzed: @375b sems rgya che zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la brten te /🔽sems can pha rol dang / gang zag pha rol gyi sems rgya che ba la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la brten te / sems can pha rol dang / gang zag pha rol gyi sems rgya che ba la /
translated: “Subhūti, how do the tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas, relying on this deep perfection of wisdom,

original: sems rgya che zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: sems rgya che zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen ce na /

original: sems can pha rol dang / gang zag pha rol gyi sems de rgya che bar mi 'gyur /

analyzed: sems de rgya chung bar mi 'gyur / sems de 'phel bar mi 'gyur /

original: sems de 'grib par mi 'gyur /

original: sems de 'ong bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: sems de 'ong bar mi 'gyur /

original: sems de 'gro bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems de 'gro bar mi 'gyur te /

analyzed: sems de dngos po med pas rgya che bar 'gyur ba ma yin /

original: rgya chung bar 'gyur ba ma yin /
analyzed: rgya chung bar 'gyur ba ma yin /

analyzed: 'phel par 'gyur ba ma yin / 'grib par 'gyur ba ma yin / 'ong bar 'gyur ba ma yin /

analyzed: 'gro bar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya bar rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: It does not go.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: de ni 'di ltar sems la gang gis rgya chen por 'gyur ba'am /

analyzed: rgya chung ngur 'gyur ba'am /
