original: sems can pha rol dang / gang zag pha rol gyi sems 'phro ba dang / 'du ba dang; bkram pa dang / bcum pa gang ji snyed cig skye zhing 'byung ba de dag thams cad kyang gzugs la brten /
analyzed: sems can pha rol dang / gang zag pha rol gyi sems 'phro ba dang / 'du ba dang; bkram pa dang / bcum pa gang ji snyed cig skye zhing 'byung ba de dag thams cad kyang gzugs la brten /
translated: “Whatever thoughts arise and occur in the minds of other beings, other persons, whether they are contracted or distracted, scattered or focused, to that extent they are based on form,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la brten pas skye zhing 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la brten pas skye zhing 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar /
translated: based on feeling, based on perception, based on volitional factors, and based on consciousness, and so they arise and occur.”🔽“Thus, Subhūti, the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas, on the basis of this deep perfection of wisdom,

original: sems can pha rol dang / gang zag pha rol gyi sems de dag rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: sems can pha rol dang / gang zag pha rol gyi sems de dag rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: know exactly the thoughts that arise and occur in the minds of other beings, other persons, whether they are contracted or distracted, scattered or focused.”

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa @378b dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la brten te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa @378b dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la brten te /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas, on the basis of this deep perfection of wisdom,

original: sems can pha rol dang / gang zag pha rol gyi sems 'phro ba dang / 'du ba dang / bkram pa dang / bcum pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: sems can pha rol dang / gang zag pha rol gyi sems 'phro ba dang / 'du ba dang / bkram pa dang / bcum pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: know exactly the thoughts that arise and occur in the minds of other beings, other persons, whether they are contracted or distracted, scattered or focused.”

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis /
translated: The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One

original: sems can pha rol dang / gang zag pha rol gyi sems 'phro ba dang / 'du ba dang / bkram pa dang / bcum pa rnam pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /🔽bdag dang 'jig rten rtag ces bya ba de nyid ba den gyi /
analyzed: sems can pha rol dang / gang zag pha rol gyi sems 'phro ba dang / 'du ba dang / bkram pa dang / bcum pa rnam pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te / bdag dang 'jig rten rtag ces bya ba de nyid ba den gyi /
translated: knows the minds of other beings and other persons, their thoughts, their intentions, their thoughts and intentions.🔽“It is only this that is true, any other view is false: the self and the world are eternal.

original: gzhan ni don med do zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: gzhan ni don med do zhes bya ba de ni /
translated: The other is meaningless.🔽

original: gzugs la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la gnas pa'o //
translated: This is based on form.

original: de ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o //🔽bdag dang 'jig rten mi rtag ces bya ba de nyid bden gyi /
analyzed: de ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o // bdag dang 'jig rten mi rtag ces bya ba de nyid bden gyi /
translated: This is based on feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.🔽“It is only this that is true, any other view is false: the self and the world are not eternal.

original: gzhan ni don med do zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: gzhan ni don med do zhes bya ba de ni /
translated: The other is meaningless.🔽

original: gzugs la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la gnas pa'o //
translated: This is based on form.

original: de ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: This is based on feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.

original: bdag dang 'jig rten rtag kyang rtag la /
analyzed: bdag dang 'jig rten rtag kyang rtag la /
translated: “It is only this that is true, any other view is false: the self and the world are both eternal and not eternal.

original: mi rtag kyang mi rtag ces bya ba de nyid bden gyi /
analyzed: mi rtag kyang mi rtag ces bya ba de nyid bden gyi /
translated: “It is impermanent, but it is not impermanent.”🔽“This alone is the truth, any other perspective is meaningless.”

original: gzhan ni don med do zhes bya ba de ni gzugs la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni don med do zhes bya ba de ni gzugs la gnas pa'o //
translated: This is to take a stand on form.

original: de ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: This is to take a stand on feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.

original: bdag dang 'jig rten ni rtag pa 'ang ma yin /🔽mi rtag pa'ang ma yin zhes bya ba de nyid bden gyi /
analyzed: bdag dang 'jig rten ni rtag pa 'ang ma yin / mi rtag pa'ang ma yin zhes bya ba de nyid bden gyi /
translated: “The self and the world are not permanent,🔽and they are not impermanent.”🔽“This alone is the truth, any other perspective is meaningless.”

original: gzhan ni don med do zhes bya ba de ni gzugs la @379a *//
analyzed: gzhan ni don med do zhes bya ba de ni gzugs la @379a *//
translated: This is to take a stand on form.

original: gnas pa'o // de ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa'o // de ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: This is to take a stand on feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.🔽“The self and the world are finite,

original: bdag dang 'jig rten ni mtha' dang ldan pa zhes bya ba de nyid bden gyi /
analyzed: bdag dang 'jig rten ni mtha' dang ldan pa zhes bya ba de nyid bden gyi /
translated: and they are not infinite.”🔽“This alone is the truth, any other perspective is meaningless.”

original: gzhan ni don med do zhes bya ba de ni gzugs la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni don med do zhes bya ba de ni gzugs la gnas pa'o //
translated: This is to take a stand on form.

original: de ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: This is to take a stand on feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.

original: bdag dang 'jig rten ni mtha' dang mi ldan pa zhes bya de ni bden gyi /
analyzed: bdag dang 'jig rten ni mtha' dang mi ldan pa zhes bya de ni bden gyi /
translated: “The world and the self are finite” is true,🔽but the rest is meaningless.

original: gzhan ni don med do zhes bya ba de ni gzugs la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni don med do zhes bya ba de ni gzugs la gnas pa'o //
translated: This is based on form.

original: de ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: This is based on feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.

original: bdag dang 'jig rten ni mtha' dang ldan pa'ang yin la /
analyzed: bdag dang 'jig rten ni mtha' dang ldan pa'ang yin la /
translated: “The world and the self are infinite” is true,🔽but the rest is meaningless.🔽This is based on form.🔽This is based on feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.

original: mtha' dang mi ldan pa'ang yin zhes bya ba de nyid bden gyi /
analyzed: mtha' dang mi ldan pa'ang yin zhes bya ba de nyid bden gyi /
translated: “The world and the self are both finite and infinite” is true,🔽but the rest is meaningless.

original: gzhan ni don med do zhes bya ba de ni gzugs la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni don med do zhes bya ba de ni gzugs la gnas pa'o //
translated: This is based on form.

original: de ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o //🔽bdag dang 'jig rten ni mtha' dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: de ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o // bdag dang 'jig rten ni mtha' dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: This is based on feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.

original: mtha' dang mi ldan pa'ang ma yin zhes bya ba de nyid bden gyi /
analyzed: mtha' dang mi ldan pa'ang ma yin zhes bya ba de nyid bden gyi /
translated: “The world and the self are neither finite nor infinite” is true,🔽but the rest is meaningless.

original: gzhan ni don med do zhes bya de ni gzugs la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni don med do zhes bya de ni gzugs la gnas pa'o //
translated: This is based on form.

original: de ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o //🔽lus de srog dang ldan zhes bya ba de nyid bden gyi /
analyzed: de ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o // lus de srog dang ldan zhes bya ba de nyid bden gyi /
translated: It is to abide in form, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness.🔽“It is to say, ‘The body is endowed with life,’ and that alone is true while the rest is meaningless.

original: gzhan ni don med do zhes bya ba de ni gzugs la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni don med do zhes bya ba de ni gzugs la gnas pa'o //
translated: This is to abide in form.

original: de ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa @379b la gnas pa'o //🔽srog kyang gzhan la lus kyang gzhan zhes bya ba de nyid bden gyi //
analyzed: de ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa @379b la gnas pa'o // srog kyang gzhan la lus kyang gzhan zhes bya ba de nyid bden gyi //
translated: It is to abide in feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness.🔽“It is to say, ‘Life is one thing and the body is another,’ and that alone is true while the rest is meaningless.

original: gzhan ni don med do zhes bya ba de ni gzugs la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni don med do zhes bya ba de ni gzugs la gnas pa'o //
translated: This is to abide in form.

original: de ni tshor dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang; rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa grongs nas yod ces bya ba de nyid bden gyi /
analyzed: de ni tshor dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang; rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o // de bzhin gshegs pa grongs nas yod ces bya ba de nyid bden gyi /
translated: It is to abide in feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness.🔽“It is to say, ‘The Tathāgata exists after death,’ and that alone is true while the rest is meaningless.

original: gzhan ni don med do zhes bya ba de ni gzugs la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni don med do zhes bya ba de ni gzugs la gnas pa'o //
translated: This is to abide in form.

original: de ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: It is to abide in feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa grongs nas med ces bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa grongs nas yod kyang yod la /🔽med kyang med ces bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa grongs nas yod par 'gyur ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa grongs nas med ces bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa grongs nas yod kyang yod la / med kyang med ces bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa grongs nas yod par 'gyur ba'ang ma yin /
translated: Thus, ‘The Tathāgata does not exist after death,’ ‘The Tathāgata both exists and does not exist after death,’

original: med par 'gyur ba'ang ma yin zhes bya ba de nyid bden gyi /
analyzed: med par 'gyur ba'ang ma yin zhes bya ba de nyid bden gyi /
translated: ‘The Tathāgata neither exists nor does not exist after death’—🔽that alone is true, and the rest is meaningless.”

original: gzhan ni don med do zhes bya ba de ni gzugs la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni don med do zhes bya ba de ni gzugs la gnas pa'o //
translated: That is based on form.

original: de ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o zhes bya bar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: de ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o zhes bya bar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: That is based on feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.”

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis /
translated: Subhūti, in that way the tathāgata, worthy one, perfectly complete buddha

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la brten te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la brten te /
translated: has relied on this deep perfection of wisdom

original: sems can pha rol dang / gang zag pha rol gyi sems 'phro ba dang / 'du ba dang / bkram pa dang / bcum pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: sems can pha rol dang / gang zag pha rol gyi sems 'phro ba dang / 'du ba dang / bkram pa dang / bcum pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the minds of other beings and other persons, their thoughts, their inclinations, their mentalities, their motivations, their dispositions, their temperaments, and their faculties, all exactly as they are.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @380a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @380a *//
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, the Tathāgata,

original: zab mo 'di la brten te /
analyzed: zab mo 'di la brten te /
translated: on the basis of this profound perfection of wisdom,

original: gzugs mkhyen to //
analyzed: gzugs mkhyen to //
translated: knows form.

original: gzugs ji ltar mkhyen ce na /🔽de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med la /
analyzed: gzugs ji ltar mkhyen ce na / de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med la /
translated: How does he know form?🔽He knows it as suchness, unmistaken suchness, unaltered suchness,

original: mtshan ma med cing byed pa med de; spros pa med cing dmigs su med pa de ltar mkhyen to //
analyzed: mtshan ma med cing byed pa med de; spros pa med cing dmigs su med pa de ltar mkhyen to //
translated: without conceptualization, without signs, without activity, without proliferation, and without reference.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mkhyen to //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mkhyen to //
translated: He knows feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa ji ltar mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ji ltar mkhyen ce na /
translated: How does he know consciousness?

original: de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med la /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med la /
translated: He knows it as suchness, unmistaken suchness, unaltered suchness,

original: mtshan ma med cing byed pa med de /
analyzed: mtshan ma med cing byed pa med de /
translated: It is signless and without any action.

original: spros pa med cing dmigs su med pa de ltar mkhyen to //
analyzed: spros pa med cing dmigs su med pa de ltar mkhyen to //
translated: It is free of conceptual elaboration and cannot be apprehended.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la brten te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la brten te /
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, the Tathāgata, relying on this profound perfection of wisdom,

original: sems can pha rol dang / gang zag pha rol gyi sems 'phro ba dang / 'du ba dang / bkram pa dang / bcum pa rnams kyang de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du rab mkhyen to //
analyzed: sems can pha rol dang / gang zag pha rol gyi sems 'phro ba dang / 'du ba dang / bkram pa dang / bcum pa rnams kyang de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du rab mkhyen to //
translated: knows the minds of other beings and other persons, their thoughts, their comings and goings, their diffuseness and their withdrawal, just as they are, in accordance with reality.

original: ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / 'gyur ba med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / byed pa med pa dang / spros pa med pa dang / dmigs su med pa ji lta ba de bzhin du mkhyen to //
analyzed: ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / 'gyur ba med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / byed pa med pa dang / spros pa med pa dang / dmigs su med pa ji lta ba de bzhin du mkhyen to //
translated: He knows them just as they are, in accordance with the unmistaken real nature, the unchanging, the nonconceptual, the signless, the inaction, the freedom from conceptual elaboration, and the unapprehendable.

original: de ltar na 'phro ba dang / 'du ba dang / bkram pa dang / bcum pa'i da bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: de ltar na 'phro ba dang / 'du ba dang / bkram pa dang / bcum pa'i da bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Thus, the real nature of thoughts, their comings and goings, their diffuseness and their withdrawal,

original: phung po'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: phung po'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: is the real nature of the aggregates.

original: phung po'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: phung po'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The suchness of the aggregates

original: skye mched kyi de bzhin nyid do //🔽skye mched kyi de @380b bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /🔽khams kyi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: skye mched kyi de bzhin nyid do // skye mched kyi de @380b bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni / khams kyi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: is the suchness of the sense spheres.🔽The suchness of the sense spheres🔽is the suchness of the elements.

original: khams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /🔽rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: khams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of the elements🔽is the suchness of dependent origination.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /🔽chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni / chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of dependent origination🔽is the suchness of all phenomena.

original: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /🔽pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni / pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of all phenomena🔽is the suchness of the six perfections.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /🔽stong pa nyid thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni / stong pa nyid thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of the six perfections🔽is the suchness of all emptinesses.

original: stong pa nyid thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: stong pa nyid thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The suchness of all emptinesses

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: is the suchness of the thirty-seven factors of awakening.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /🔽bsam gtan bzhi'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni / bsam gtan bzhi'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of the thirty-seven factors of awakening🔽is the suchness of the four concentrations.

original: bsam gtan bzhi'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /🔽tshad med pa bzhi'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni / tshad med pa bzhi'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of the four concentrations🔽is the suchness of the four immeasurables.

original: tshad med pa bzhi'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The suchness of the four immeasurables

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: is the suchness of the four formless absorptions.

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The suchness of the four formless absorptions

original: mngon par shes pa lnga'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: is the suchness of the five kinds of superknowledge.

original: mngon par shes pa lnga'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /🔽rnam par thar pa brgyad kyi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni / rnam par thar pa brgyad kyi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of the five kinds of superknowledge🔽is the suchness of the eight liberations.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The suchness of the eight liberations

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: is the suchness of the nine serial absorptions.

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa @381a *//
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa @381a *//
translated: The suchness of the nine serial absorptions

original: de ni / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de ni / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: is the suchness of the emptiness gate of liberation, the signlessness gate of liberation, and the wishlessness gate of liberation.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The suchness of the emptiness gate of liberation, the signlessness gate of liberation, and the wishlessness gate of liberation

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: is the suchness of the ten powers of the tathāgatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The suchness of the ten powers of the tathāgatas

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: is the suchness of the four fearlessnesses.

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /🔽so so yang dag par rig ba bzhi'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni / so so yang dag par rig ba bzhi'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of the four fearlessnesses🔽is the suchness of the four detailed and thorough knowledges.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The suchness of the four detailed and thorough knowledges

original: byams pa chen po'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: byams pa chen po'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: is the suchness of great love.

original: byams pa chen po'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /🔽snying rje chen po'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: byams pa chen po'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni / snying rje chen po'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of great love is the suchness of great compassion.🔽

original: snying rje chen po'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: snying rje chen po'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The suchness of great love is the suchness of great compassion.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of great compassion is the suchness of the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni; rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid do //🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni; rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid do // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The suchness of the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas is the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: dge ba'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid do //🔽dge ba'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /🔽mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid do // dge ba'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni / mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of the knowledge of all aspects is the suchness of wholesome dharmas.

original: mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The suchness of wholesome dharmas is the suchness of unwholesome dharmas.🔽The suchness of unwholesome dharmas is the suchness of mundane dharmas.

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams @381b kyi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams @381b kyi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of mundane dharmas is the suchness of supramundane dharmas.

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /🔽'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid do //🔽'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid do // 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The suchness of mundane dharmas is the suchness of supramundane dharmas.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid do //🔽zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /🔽zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid do // zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of supramundane dharmas is the suchness of dharmas with outflows.

original: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /🔽'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid do //🔽'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid do // 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The suchness of dharmas with outflows is the suchness of dharmas without outflows.🔽The suchness of dharmas without outflows is the suchness of past, future, and present dharmas.

original: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of past, future, and present dharmas is the suchness of conditioned and unconditioned dharmas.

original: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The suchness of conditioned and unconditioned phenomena

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i de bzhin nyid do //🔽rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i de bzhin nyid do // rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
translated: is the suchness of the fruit of entering the stream.🔽The suchness of the fruit of entering the stream

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i de bzhin nyid do //🔽lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i de bzhin nyid do // lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
translated: is the suchness of the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth.🔽The suchness of the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: is the suchness of the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The suchness of the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth

original: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid do //🔽dgra bcom pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid do // dgra bcom pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
translated: is the suchness of arhatship.🔽The suchness of arhatship

original: rang byang chub kyi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: rang byang chub kyi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: is the suchness of individual enlightenment.

original: rang byang chub kyi de bzhin @382a *//🔽nyid gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: rang byang chub kyi de bzhin @382a *//🔽nyid gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The suchness of individual enlightenment🔽is the suchness of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: the suchness of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
translated: the suchness of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: the suchness of the Tathāgata,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
translated: the suchness of the Tathāgata,

original: de bzhin nyid gcig pa nyid de tha mi dad pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid gcig pa nyid de tha mi dad pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: and the suchness of all dharmas is one single suchness, undifferentiated suchness.

original: tha mi dad pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The undifferentiated suchness

original: mi zad pa ste mi zad pa'i phyir gnyis su med de /
analyzed: mi zad pa ste mi zad pa'i phyir gnyis su med de /
translated: is inexhaustible, and because it is inexhaustible, it is nondual,

original: gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: gnyis su byar med do //
translated: and cannot be made two.

original: rab 'byor / de ni chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid de /
translated: Subhūti, that is the suchness of all dharmas,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten te /
translated: and the Tathāgata, relying on this perfection of wisdom,

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: has fully awakened to it.

original: rab 'byor / de lta bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de lta bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni /
translated: “Therefore, Subhūti, this deep perfection of wisdom

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa'o //
translated: It is the generation of the Tathāgata.

original: 'jig rten 'di ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di ston pa'o //
translated: It is the manifestation of this world.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis /
translated: Subhūti, in this way the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One

original: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid thugs su chud do //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid thugs su chud do //
translated: has realized the suchness of all phenomena.

original: ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid thugs su chud do //
analyzed: ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid thugs su chud do //
translated: He has realized the unerring suchness and the unaltered suchness.

original: de bzhin nyid des na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid des na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: By that suchness, he is called the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One.”

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Blessed One,🔽this suchness of all phenomena,

original: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid @382b dang; gzhan ma lags pa de bzhin nyid 'di ni zab pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid @382b dang; gzhan ma lags pa de bzhin nyid 'di ni zab pa ste /
translated: this unerring suchness and unaltered suchness is profound.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma lags pa de bzhin nyid des na; sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub brjod cing smos so //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma lags pa de bzhin nyid des na; sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub brjod cing smos so //
translated: The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One has taught the enlightenment of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, by means of the suchness of all dharmas, the unmistaken suchness, the unaltered suchness.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: slar mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang / gang zag lta ba phun sum tshogs pa rnams dang / dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa rnams ma gtogs par su zhig 'di la mos par gyur /
analyzed: slar mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang / gang zag lta ba phun sum tshogs pa rnams dang / dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa rnams ma gtogs par su zhig 'di la mos par gyur /
translated: who other than irreversible Bodhisattva Great Beings, individuals with perfect view, and Arhats with exhausted defilements could believe in this?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas chos de dag mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas chos de dag mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: the Tathāgata, having fully awakened to those dharmas,

original: sems can rnams la gsungs pa ni shin tu zab bo //
analyzed: sems can rnams la gsungs pa ni shin tu zab bo //
translated: has taught them to sentient beings. They are extremely profound.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar de bzhin nyid mi zad pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar de bzhin nyid mi zad pa ste /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this: suchness is inexhaustible.

original: ci'i phyir mi zad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi zad ce na /
translated: Why is it inexhaustible?

original: chos thams cad ni mi zad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni mi zad pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because all dharmas are inexhaustible.

original: de bzhin nyid de ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis /🔽bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid de ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: That suchness was taught to sentient beings by the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly awakened Buddha,

original: sems can rnams la gsungs te /
analyzed: sems can rnams la gsungs te /
translated: after he had attained supreme, perfect awakening.

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: It is the suchness of all phenomena.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-five Thousand Lines,

original: le'u sum cu gnyis pa'o ////🔽de nas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'i 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / @383a *//
analyzed: le'u sum cu gnyis pa'o //// de nas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'i 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / @383a *//
translated: this was chapter thirty-two.

original: gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu gang ji snyed pa de dag lha rdzas kyi tsan dan gyi phye mas mngon par 'thor zhing /
analyzed: gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu gang ji snyed pa de dag lha rdzas kyi tsan dan gyi phye mas mngon par 'thor zhing /
translated: Then all the gods of the desire realm and the form realm in this great trichiliocosm, having scattered divine sandalwood powder,

original: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der dong sti phyin nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der dong sti phyin nas /
translated: went to where the Blessed One was.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
translated: and having bowed their heads at the feet of the Lord, they sat down to one side.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'khod nas /
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'khod nas /
translated: and having sat down to one side,

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu gang ji snyed pa de dag gis /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu gang ji snyed pa de dag gis /
translated: all the gods of the desire realm and the form realm

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: said this to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo bshad na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo bshad na /
translated: when the profound perfection of wisdom is explained,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo'i mtshan nyid ji lta bu lags /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo'i mtshan nyid ji lta bu lags /
translated: what are the defining marks of the profound perfection of wisdom?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: “Divine princes,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: this profound perfection of wisdom has the defining mark of emptiness.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Divine princes,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni mtshan ma med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni mtshan ma med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: this profound perfection of wisdom has the defining mark of signlessness.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Divine princes,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni /
translated: this profound perfection of wisdom has the defining mark of wishlessness.

original: smon pa med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: smon pa med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the characteristic of wishlessness.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Divine princes!

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni /
translated: This profound perfection of wisdom

original: mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: has the characteristic of being unconditioned.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Divine princes!

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni /
translated: This profound perfection of wisdom

original: skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: has the characteristic of non-arising.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Divine princes!

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni /
translated: This profound perfection of wisdom

original: 'gag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'gag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: has the characteristic of non-cessation.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Divine princes!

original: shes rab kyi pha rol @383b rab tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol @383b rab tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni /
translated: This profound perfection of wisdom

original: nyon mongs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: has the characteristic of being free from affliction.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Divine princes!

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni /
translated: This profound perfection of wisdom

original: rnam par byang ba med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
