original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Divine princes!

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni /
translated: This profound perfection of wisdom

original: dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: has the characteristic of being non-existent.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Divine princes!

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni /
translated: This profound perfection of wisdom

original: ngo bo nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: is characterized by the absence of an essence.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Divine princes,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni /
translated: this profound perfection of wisdom

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: is characterized by the absence of an inherent nature.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Divine princes,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni /
translated: this profound perfection of wisdom

original: mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: is characterized by non-abiding.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Divine princes,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni /
translated: this profound perfection of wisdom

original: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: is characterized by space.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Divine princes,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni /
translated: this profound perfection of wisdom

original: mtshan nyid de lta bu yin yang /
analyzed: mtshan nyid de lta bu yin yang /
translated: has such characteristics,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas 'jig rten gyi brdar bka' stsal te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas 'jig rten gyi brdar bka' stsal te /
translated: but the Tathāgata has taught it as a convention of the world,

original: don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: not ultimately.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Divine princes,

original: mtshan nyid de dag ni lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis gzhan du bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de dag ni lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis gzhan du bya bar mi nus so //
translated: those characteristics cannot be changed by the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten yang mtshan nyid der zad de /
analyzed: lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten yang mtshan nyid der zad de /
translated: Because the world with its gods, humans, and asuras is exhausted as a characteristic.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Divine princes,

original: mtshan nyid ni mtshan nyid gzhan du mi byed do //🔽mtshan nyid ni mtshan nyid shes par mi byed do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni mtshan nyid gzhan du mi byed do // mtshan nyid ni mtshan nyid shes par mi byed do //
translated: a characteristic does not make another characteristic.

original: mtshan nyid ni mtshan nyid med pa shes par mi byed do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni mtshan nyid med pa shes par mi byed do //
translated: A characteristic does not make a non-characteristic.🔽A characteristic does not make a characteristic and a non-characteristic.

original: mtshan nyid med pa ni mtshan nyid med pa shes par mi byed do //🔽de ltar na mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid med @384a *//
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa ni mtshan nyid med pa shes par mi byed do // de ltar na mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid med @384a *//
translated: A non-characteristic does not make a non-characteristic.🔽A non-characteristic does not make a characteristic.🔽A non-characteristic does not make a characteristic and a non-characteristic.

original: pa dang / mtshan nyid yod pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa de gnyis ka la'ang gang gis shes par bya ba dang / gang shes par bya ba dang / gang shes par byed pa de lta bu mi srid do //
analyzed: pa dang / mtshan nyid yod pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa de gnyis ka la'ang gang gis shes par bya ba dang / gang shes par bya ba dang / gang shes par byed pa de lta bu mi srid do //
translated: Thus, in both a characteristic and a non-characteristic, it is impossible to have an object of knowledge, a knower, and an act of knowing.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Divine princes,

original: mtshan nyid de dag ni gzugs kyis 'du byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de dag ni gzugs kyis 'du byas pa ma yin no //
translated: those characteristics are not conditioned by form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pas 'du byas pa ma yin no; ;skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung bas 'du byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pas 'du byas pa ma yin no; ;skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung bas 'du byas pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not created by feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness. It is not created by the sense spheres, elements, or dependent origination.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol phyin pas 'du byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol phyin pas 'du byas pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not created by the perfection of generosity.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas 'du byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas 'du byas pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not created by the perfection of ethical discipline, the perfection of patient acceptance, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of meditative concentration, or the perfection of wisdom.

original: stong pa nyid thams cad kyis 'du byas pa ma yin no //🔽byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyis 'du byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid thams cad kyis 'du byas pa ma yin no // byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyis 'du byas pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not created by any of the emptinesses.🔽It is not created by the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams kyis 'du byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams kyis 'du byas pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not created by the four noble truths.

original: bsam gtan dang; tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang; tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang /
translated: the meditative stabilities, the immeasurable aspirations, the formless meditative stabilities, the eight deliverances, the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness,

original: mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so @384b so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyis 'du byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so @384b so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyis 'du byas pa ma yin no //
translated: the [supernatural] abilities, the meditative stabilizations, the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyis 'du byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyis 'du byas pa ma yin no //
translated: up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: “Divine princes,

original: mtshan nyid de dag ni mi'am /
analyzed: mtshan nyid de dag ni mi'am /
translated: those defining marks are not human,

original: mi ma yin pa'am /🔽zag pa dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: mi ma yin pa'am / zag pa dang bcas pa'am /
translated: nor are they non-human.🔽They are not with outflows,

original: zag pa med pa'am /🔽'jig rten pa'am /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'am / 'jig rten pa'am /
translated: nor are they without outflows.🔽They are not mundane,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa 'am /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa 'am /
translated: nor are they supramundane.

original: 'dus byas sam /
analyzed: 'dus byas sam /
translated: They are not compounded,

original: 'dus ma byas kyis ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyis ma yin te /
translated: It is not unconditioned.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Divine princes,

original: la la zhig 'di skad du nam mkha'i mtshan nyid gang yin zhes zer na /
analyzed: la la zhig 'di skad du nam mkha'i mtshan nyid gang yin zhes zer na /
translated: if someone were to ask, “What is the defining characteristic of space?”

original: ci de yang dag par smra bas yang dag par smra ba yin nam /
analyzed: ci de yang dag par smra bas yang dag par smra ba yin nam /
translated: would that person who asks that question be asking correctly?

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: They replied, “Blessed One,

original: de ni ma lags te /
analyzed: de ni ma lags te /
translated: no, he would not.

original: yang dag par smra bas yang dag par smra ba ma lags so //
analyzed: yang dag par smra bas yang dag par smra ba ma lags so //
translated: That person would not be asking correctly.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'dus ma bgyis pa'i slad du nam mkha' la ni mtshan nyid gang yang ma mchis so //
analyzed: 'dus ma bgyis pa'i slad du nam mkha' la ni mtshan nyid gang yang ma mchis so //
translated: space has no defining characteristic, because it is unconditioned.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: lha'i bu dag /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
translated: “Divine princes,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste /🔽mtshan nyid med pa'i dbyings de ni de bzhin du gnas so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste / mtshan nyid med pa'i dbyings de ni de bzhin du gnas so //
translated: whether the thus-gone ones appear or not,🔽the realm of phenomena remains just as it is.

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i dbyings ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa de ni /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i dbyings ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa de ni /
translated: The realm of phenomena remains just as it is,🔽and the realm of phenomena is just as it is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas ma nor bar mngon par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas ma nor bar mngon par sangs rgyas te /
translated: The Thus-Gone One has awakened to this without error.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he is called the Thus-Gone One.

original: de nas 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu de dag gis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu de dag gis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the gods of the desire realm and the form realm said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: mtshan @385a *// nyid de dag mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas /
analyzed: mtshan @385a *// nyid de dag mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas /
translated: by fully awakening to these characteristics,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes gzigs pa chos thams cad la thogs pa ma mchis par 'jug cing mtshan nyid de dag la zhugs pas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes gzigs pa chos thams cad la thogs pa ma mchis par 'jug cing mtshan nyid de dag la zhugs pas /
translated: the Thus-Gone One’s wisdom vision penetrates all phenomena without obstruction. By penetrating these characteristics,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis /
translated: the Thus-Gone One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Buddha

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtshan nyid thams cad kyi chags pa las 'das pa 'di mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtshan nyid thams cad kyi chags pa las 'das pa 'di mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: has fully awakened to this perfection of wisdom, which transcends all characteristics.

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang /
translated: Having fully awakened to this,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par bstan pas mtshan nyid rnams rab tu bstan pa ni /🔽de bzhin gshegs pas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par bstan pas mtshan nyid rnams rab tu bstan pa ni / de bzhin gshegs pas /
translated: The characteristics are taught by the perfect teaching of the perfection of wisdom.🔽The Tathāgata🔽

original: mtshan nyid zab mo mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid zab mo mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: The Tathāgata has fully awakened to the profound characteristics.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyod yul du gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyod yul du gyur te /
translated: in that way, the profound perfection of wisdom is the domain of the tathāgatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened buddhas.

original: de la spyad pas de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis /🔽bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: de la spyad pas de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: By practicing it, the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas🔽have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang /
translated: Having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: mtshan nyid thams cad rab tu dbye bar mdzad de /
analyzed: mtshan nyid thams cad rab tu dbye bar mdzad de /
translated: they have distinguished all the characteristics.

original: 'di ltar gzugs kyi mtshan nyid dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / @385b rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid dang / skye mched kyi mtshan nyid dang / khams kyi mtshan nyid dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs kyi mtshan nyid dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / @385b rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid dang / skye mched kyi mtshan nyid dang / khams kyi mtshan nyid dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid dang /
translated: The characteristics of form, the characteristics of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness, the characteristics of the sense fields, the characteristics of the constituents, the characteristics of dependent origination,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi mtshan nyid rab tu dbye ba mdzad pa ngo mtshar che'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi mtshan nyid rab tu dbye ba mdzad pa ngo mtshar che'o //
translated: up to the characteristics of the knowledge of all aspects—that is amazing!”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu rnams la bkal stsal pa; lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu rnams la bkal stsal pa; lha'i bu dag /
translated: The Lord then said to the gods in the desire realm and the gods in the form realm, “Gods,

original: gzugs ni gzhig tu rung ba'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: gzugs ni gzhig tu rung ba'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: form has the characteristic of being destructible.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: The Tathāgata has fully awakened to the absence of the characteristic of form.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba ni myong ba'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba ni myong ba'i mtshan nyid /
translated: Similarly, feeling has the characteristic of experience.

original: 'du shes ni 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: 'du shes ni 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid /
translated: Perception has the characteristic of grasping.

original: 'du byed ni mngon par 'du byed pa'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: 'du byed ni mngon par 'du byed pa'i mtshan nyid /
translated: Formation has the characteristic of forming.

original: rnam par shes pa ni so so'i bye brag shes pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni so so'i bye brag shes pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Consciousness has the characteristic of being aware of each object.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: The Tathāgata has fully and perfectly realized that these have no intrinsic nature.

original: phung po rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid /
analyzed: phung po rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid /
translated: The aggregates have the characteristic of suffering.

original: khams rnams ni gdug pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: khams rnams ni gdug pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The elements have the characteristic of being poisonous.

original: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: The Tathāgata has fully and perfectly realized that these have no intrinsic nature.

original: skye mched rnams ni 'byung ba'i sgo'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: skye mched rnams ni 'byung ba'i sgo'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The sense-spheres have the characteristic of being doors of arising.

original: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: The Tathāgata has fully and perfectly realized that these have no intrinsic nature.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni 'du 'phrod kyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni 'du 'phrod kyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: Dependent origination has the characteristic of a combination.

original: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: The Tathāgata has fully awakened to the absence of characteristics of those.

original: lha'i bu @386a *//
analyzed: lha'i bu @386a *//
translated: “Divine princes,

original: dag; sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni yongs su gtong ba'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: dag; sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni yongs su gtong ba'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: the perfection of generosity has the characteristic of relinquishing.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so; ;tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gdung ba med pa'i mtshan nyid /🔽bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'khrug pa med pa'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so; ;tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gdung ba med pa'i mtshan nyid / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'khrug pa med pa'i mtshan nyid /
translated: The Tathāgata has fully awakened to the absence of characteristics of that. The perfection of morality has the characteristic of being free of torment.🔽The perfection of patience has the characteristic of being free of disturbance.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni thub pa med pa'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni thub pa med pa'i mtshan nyid /
translated: The perfection of perseverance has the characteristic of being invincible.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni yang dag par sdud pa'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni yang dag par sdud pa'i mtshan nyid /
translated: The perfection of concentration has the characteristic of correct unification.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The perfection of wisdom has the characteristic of being free of attachment.

original: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: The Tathāgata has fully awakened to the non-characteristics of those.

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dag ni mi 'khrugs pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dag ni mi 'khrugs pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The four concentrations, four immeasurables, and four formless absorptions have the characteristic of non-disturbance.

original: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: The Tathāgata has fully awakened to the non-characteristics of those.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun ni 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun ni 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening have the characteristic of arising.

original: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: The Tathāgata has fully awakened to the non-characteristics of those.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid ni dben pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid ni dben pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The emptiness gate of liberation has the characteristic of isolation.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: The Tathāgata has fully awakened to the non-characteristics of that.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa ni zhi ba'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa ni zhi ba'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The signless gate of liberation has the characteristic of peace.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan @386b nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan @386b nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: The Tathāgata has fully awakened to the absence of defining characteristics of the absence of wishes.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa ni sdug bsngal sel ba'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa ni sdug bsngal sel ba'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The absence of wishes as a gateway to liberation has the defining characteristic of eliminating suffering.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: The Tathāgata has fully awakened to the absence of defining characteristics of the absence of wishes.

original: rnam par thar pa rnams ni 'grel pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa rnams ni 'grel pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The gateways to liberation have the defining characteristic of being liberating.

original: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: The Tathāgata has fully awakened to the absence of defining characteristics of the gateways to liberation.

original: stobs rnams ni shin tu rnam par gdon mi za ba'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: stobs rnams ni shin tu rnam par gdon mi za ba'i mtshan nyid /
translated: The powers have the defining characteristic of being utterly irreversible.

original: mi 'jigs pa rnams ni shin tu brtan pa'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa rnams ni shin tu brtan pa'i mtshan nyid /
translated: The fearlessnesses have the defining characteristic of being utterly stable.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams ni yongs su mi chod pa'i mtshan nyid /🔽byams pa chen po ni phan par sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams ni yongs su mi chod pa'i mtshan nyid / byams pa chen po ni phan par sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid /
translated: The correct understandings have the defining characteristic of being unassailable.🔽Great love has the defining characteristic of accomplishing benefit.

original: snying rje chen po ni skyob pa'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: snying rje chen po ni skyob pa'i mtshan nyid /
translated: Great compassion has the defining characteristic of protecting.

original: dga' ba chen po ni rab tu dga' ba'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: dga' ba chen po ni rab tu dga' ba'i mtshan nyid /
translated: Great joy is the characteristic of complete joy.

original: btang snyoms chen po ni ma 'dres pa'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: btang snyoms chen po ni ma 'dres pa'i mtshan nyid /
translated: Great equanimity is the characteristic of non-mixture.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos 'dres pa bco brgyad ni mi 'phrogs pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos 'dres pa bco brgyad ni mi 'phrogs pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha are the characteristic of non-usurpation.

original: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: The Tathagata has fully and perfectly realized these as having no characteristics.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes ni mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes ni mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: The wisdom of omniscience is the characteristic of direct perception.

original: de ni bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de ni bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: The Tathagata has fully and perfectly realized this as having no characteristics.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Divine sons!

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas /🔽de'i phyir na de bzhin gshegs pa ni chags pa mi mnga' ba'i ye @387a *//
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas / de'i phyir na de bzhin gshegs pa ni chags pa mi mnga' ba'i ye @387a *//
translated: Thus, the Tathagata has fully and perfectly realized all phenomena as having no characteristics.

original: shes can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes can zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the Tathagata is called the one with unobstructed wisdom.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Lord said to the venerable Subhūti:

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu byin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa skyed pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu byin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa skyed pa ste /
translated: “Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom is the producer of the Tathāgatas.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten ston pa'o //🔽de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten ston pa'o // de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the teacher of the world.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos 'di la brten cing rnam par spyod do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos 'di la brten cing rnam par spyod do //
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened Buddha relies on and practices this perfection of wisdom, namely:🔽the perfection of wisdom.

original: chos de la rim gror mdzad cing mchod pa mdzad do //
analyzed: chos de la rim gror mdzad cing mchod pa mdzad do //
translated: He honors and worships that Dharma.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de bzhin gshegs pa rim gro mdzad pa dang / bkur sti mdzad pa dang / bsti stang mdzad pa dang / mchod pa mdzad pa de ni chos dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de bzhin gshegs pa rim gro mdzad pa dang / bkur sti mdzad pa dang / bsti stang mdzad pa dang / mchod pa mdzad pa de ni chos dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The Tathāgata’s honoring, respecting, revering, and worshipping the perfection of wisdom is in accordance with the Dharma.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: rab 'byor / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
translated: Subhūti, the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las byung ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las byung ste /
translated: “Subhūti, this perfection of wisdom has come forth from the Tathāgata,

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni byas pa mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni byas pa mkhyen pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, the Tathāgata, worthy one, perfectly complete Buddha knows what has been done.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni byas pa dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni byas pa dgongs pa'o //
translated: The Tathāgata, worthy one, perfectly complete Buddha thinks about what has been done.

original: rab 'byor / gang la la zhig yang dag par smra bas byas pa shes shing byas pa dran pa'o zhes smra na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang la la zhig yang dag par smra bas byas pa shes shing byas pa dran pa'o zhes smra na /
translated: Subhūti, if someone were to say correctly, ‘One who knows what has been done and remembers what has been done,’

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la byas pa mkhyen cing byas pa dgongs pa'o zhes yang dag par smra bas /🔽yang dag par smra'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la byas pa mkhyen cing byas pa dgongs pa'o zhes yang dag par smra bas / yang dag par smra'o //
translated: they would say correctly, ‘The Tathāgata knows what has been done and thinks about what has been done.’

original: rab @387b 'byor; ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pas byas pa mkhyen cing byas pa dgongs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rab @387b 'byor; ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pas byas pa mkhyen cing byas pa dgongs pa yin zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, how does the Tathāgata know what has been done and think about what has been done?

original: rab 'byor / de ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas theg pa gang gis byon pa dang / lam gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur pa'i theg pa de nyid dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas theg pa gang gis byon pa dang / lam gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur pa'i theg pa de nyid dang /
translated: Subhuti, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Fully Enlightened One, by whatever vehicle he came, and by whatever path he fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, that very vehicle and that very path he has made known to others.🔽

original: lam de nyid la de bzhin gshegs pa rim gro mdzad pa dang / bkur sti mdzad pa dang / bsti stang mdzad pa dang / mchod pa mdzad pa dang / yongs su bsrung ba mdzad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lam de nyid la de bzhin gshegs pa rim gro mdzad pa dang / bkur sti mdzad pa dang / bsti stang mdzad pa dang / mchod pa mdzad pa dang / yongs su bsrung ba mdzad pa'i phyir te /
translated: Subhūti, it is because the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, by whatever vehicle he came, and by whatever path he fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, that very vehicle and that very path are honored, revered, respected, and worshipped by the Tathāgata, and are well protected.

original: rab 'byor / de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i byas pa mkhyen pa dang / byas pa dgongs par blta'o //🔽rab 'byor / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa la brten te; byed pa po med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i byas pa mkhyen pa dang / byas pa dgongs par blta'o // rab 'byor / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa la brten te; byed pa po med pa'i phyir /
translated: Subhūti, that is the Tathāgata’s knowledge of what is to be done and his knowledge of the fulfillment of what is to be done.

original: chos thams cad ma byas par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: chos thams cad ma byas par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the Tathāgata, relying on all phenomena being without signs, fully awakened to all phenomena as unmade, because there is no maker.

original: lus med pa'i phyir ma byas par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: lus med pa'i phyir ma byas par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: because it has no body, it is fully awakened to without having done anything.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten te /
translated: Subhūti, in that way the Tathāgata, dependent on the perfection of wisdom,

original: chos thams cad la bya ba med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad la bya ba med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de ni /
translated: is fully awakened to all dharmas as having no activity.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byas pa mkhyen pa dang / byas pa dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byas pa mkhyen pa dang / byas pa dgongs pa'o //
translated: That is the Tathāgata’s knowledge of what has been done and knowledge of the requital of what has been done.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten te /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, dependent on the perfection of wisdom,

original: da bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi ye shes @388a *//
analyzed: da bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi ye shes @388a *//
translated: the Tathāgata, worthy one, perfectly complete Buddha

original: byas pa med pa /
analyzed: byas pa med pa /
translated: has no activity,

original: chos thams cad la 'jug pa med pa'i brdas 'jug ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad la 'jug pa med pa'i brdas 'jug ste /
translated: and enters into all dharmas by the sign of non-entry.

original: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des na /
translated: Subhūti, by way of this one of many explanations

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa'o //
translated: the perfection of wisdom gives birth to the Tathāgata,

original: 'jig rten 'di ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di ston pa'o //
translated: and shows this world.🔽Subhūti said,

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /🔽bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /🔽bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: de ltar chos thams cad la shes pa po ma mchis shing /
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad la shes pa po ma mchis shing /
translated: “If all phenomena are without a knower,

original: mthong ba po ma mchis na /
analyzed: mthong ba po ma mchis na /
translated: and without a seer,

original: ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed cing 'jig rten 'di ston pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed cing 'jig rten 'di ston pa lags /
translated: how does the perfection of wisdom give rise to the tathāgatas and reveal this world?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said!

original: chos thams cad ni shes pa po med cing mthong ba po med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni shes pa po med cing mthong ba po med pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are without a knower and without a seer.

original: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni stong pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni stong pa /
translated: Subhūti, all phenomena are empty,

original: gsog / gsob /🔽dbang med pa /
analyzed: gsog / gsob / dbang med pa /
translated: hollow, and false.🔽They are powerless

original: snying po med pa ste; rab 'byor /
analyzed: snying po med pa ste; rab 'byor /
translated: and without essence.

original: rnam grangs des na chos thams cad ni shes pa po med cing mthong ba po med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs des na chos thams cad ni shes pa po med cing mthong ba po med pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, for this reason all phenomena are without a knower and without a seer.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang chos thams cad ni shes pa po med cing mthong ba po med pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang chos thams cad ni shes pa po med cing mthong ba po med pa ste /
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, all phenomena are without a knower and without a seer.

original: rab 'byor / ji ltar na chos thams cad shes pa po med cing mthong ba po med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ji ltar na chos thams cad shes pa po med cing mthong ba po med pa yin zhe na /
translated: Subhūti, how are all phenomena without a knower and without a seer?

original: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni mi gnas shing khongs su chud pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni mi gnas shing khongs su chud pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: Subhūti, all phenomena are not located and are not included.

original: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des na chos thams cad shes pa po med cing mthong ba po med pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des na chos thams cad shes pa po med cing mthong ba po med pa ste /
translated: Subhūti, for that reason all phenomena are without a knower and without a seer.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig @388b rten 'di ston pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig @388b rten 'di ston pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, in that way the perfection of wisdom gives birth to the tathāgatas and shows this world.

original: de'ang gzugs mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston pa'o //
analyzed: de'ang gzugs mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston pa'o //
translated: It shows it because form is not seen.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston pa'o //
translated: It shows it because feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not seen.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston pa'o //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston pa'o //
translated: It shows it because the sense spheres, elements, and dependent origination are not seen.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston pa'o //
translated: It shows it because up to omniscience is not seen.

original: rab 'byor / de lta na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de lta na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, in that way the perfection of wisdom gives birth to the Tathāgata and shows the world.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ji ltar na gzugs mthong ba ma mchis pa'i slad du ston pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na gzugs mthong ba ma mchis pa'i slad du ston pa lags /
translated: how does it show form because it is not seen?

original: ji ltar na tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mthong ba ma mchis pa'i slad du ston pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mthong ba ma mchis pa'i slad du ston pa lags /
translated: How does it show feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness because they are not seen?

original: ji ltar na skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mthong ba ma mchis pa'i slad du ston pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mthong ba ma mchis pa'i slad du ston pa lags /
translated: How does it show the sense domains, elements, and dependent origination because they are not seen?

original: ji ltar na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mthong ba ma mchis pa'i slad du ston pa lags ////
analyzed: ji ltar na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mthong ba ma mchis pa'i slad du ston pa lags ////
translated: How does it show up to the knowledge of all aspects because it is not seen?”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa /🔽bam po bzhi bcu drug pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa / bam po bzhi bcu drug pa /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-Five Thousand Lines🔽The Blessed One said,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / nam gzugs la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / nam gzugs la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, when consciousness that takes form as an object does not arise,

original: gzugs mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston pa'o //
translated: it is taught because form is not seen.

original: nam tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba'i tshe /
analyzed: nam tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba'i tshe /
translated: When consciousness that takes feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness as objects does not arise,

original: rnam @389a *// par shes pa mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston pa'o //
analyzed: rnam @389a *// par shes pa mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston pa'o //
translated: it is taught because consciousness is not seen.🔽When consciousness that takes the sense spheres, constituents, and dependent origination as objects does not arise,

original: nam skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba'i tshe; rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston pa'o //
analyzed: nam skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba'i tshe; rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston pa'o //
translated: it is taught because dependent origination is not seen.

original: nam pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba'i tshe /
analyzed: nam pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba'i tshe /
translated: When consciousness that takes the perfections as objects does not arise,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston pa'o //
translated: it is taught because the perfections are not seen.

original: nam stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang /
analyzed: nam stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang /
translated: When consciousness does not arise in relation to emptiness, the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment, the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the eight deliverances,

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang /
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang /
translated: the nine serial absorptions, the emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness that are gateways to liberation, the superknowledges, the meditative stabilities, the dhāraṇī gateways,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba'i tshe /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba'i tshe /
translated: the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston pa'o //
translated: It is a teacher because the eighteen dharmas exclusive to a Buddha are not seen.

original: nam rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba'i tshe /
analyzed: nam rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba'i tshe /
translated: When consciousness that takes as its object even omniscience does not occur,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mthong @389b pa med pa'i phyir ston pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mthong @389b pa med pa'i phyir ston pa'o //
translated: it is a teacher because omniscience is not seen.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, in this way, this profound perfection of wisdom gives birth to the Tathāgata and teaches the world.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang ji ltar na shes rab pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang ji ltar na shes rab pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa yin zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, moreover, how does the perfection of wisdom give birth to the Tathāgata and teach the world?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten du stong pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten du stong pa zhes brjod de /
translated: Subhūti, in this regard, the perfection of wisdom is called ‘emptiness’ in the world.

original: 'jig rten du ci stong pa zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'jig rten du ci stong pa zhes brjod ce na /
translated: What is called ‘emptiness’ in the world?

original: phung po lnga stong ngo zhes bya bar 'jig rten du brjod do //
analyzed: phung po lnga stong ngo zhes bya bar 'jig rten du brjod do //
translated: The five aggregates are called ‘empty’ in the world.

original: skye mched bcu gnyis stong ngo zhes bya bar 'jig rten du brjod do //
analyzed: skye mched bcu gnyis stong ngo zhes bya bar 'jig rten du brjod do //
translated: The twelve sense-spheres are empty.

original: khams bco brgyad stong ngo zhes bya bar 'jig rten du brjod do //
analyzed: khams bco brgyad stong ngo zhes bya bar 'jig rten du brjod do //
translated: The eighteen elements are empty.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis stong ngo zhes bya bar 'jig rten du brjod do //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis stong ngo zhes bya bar 'jig rten du brjod do //
translated: The twelve limbs of Dependent Origination are empty.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug stong ngo zhes bya bar 'jig rten du brjod do //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug stong ngo zhes bya bar 'jig rten du brjod do //
translated: The six perfections are empty.

original: nang stong pa nyid stong ngo zhes bya bar 'jig rten du brjod do //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid stong ngo zhes bya bar 'jig rten du brjod do //
translated: The emptiness of internal phenomena is empty.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du stong ngo zhes bya bar 'jig rten du brjod do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du stong ngo zhes bya bar 'jig rten du brjod do //
translated: The emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities is empty.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun stong ngo zhes bya bar 'jig rten du brjod do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun stong ngo zhes bya bar 'jig rten du brjod do //
translated: The thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment are empty.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang /
translated: the meditative stabilities, the immeasurable aspirations, the formless meditative stabilizations, the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions, the emptiness gate of liberation,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon @390a *//
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon @390a *//
translated: the signlessness gate of liberation,

original: pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang /
analyzed: pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang /
translated: the wishlessness gate of liberation, the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilities, the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love,

original: snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad stong ngo zhes bya bar 'jig rten du brjod do; ;rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du stong ngo zhes bya bar 'jig rten du brjod do //
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad stong ngo zhes bya bar 'jig rten du brjod do; ;rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du stong ngo zhes bya bar 'jig rten du brjod do //
translated: Up to and including omniscience, Subhūti, it is said in the world that it is empty.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa'o //
translated: In that way, Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom gives birth to the tathāgatas and shows the world.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten stong zhes bya bar ston /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten stong zhes bya bar ston /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom shows the tathāgatas that the world is empty.

original: 'jig rten stong zhes bya bar brjod /
analyzed: 'jig rten stong zhes bya bar brjod /
translated: It is said in the world that the world is empty.

original: 'jig rten stong zhes bya bar shes par byed de /
analyzed: 'jig rten stong zhes bya bar shes par byed de /
translated: It is known in the world that the world is empty.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa'o //
translated: In that way, Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom gives birth to the tathāgatas and shows the world.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten stong zhes bya bar ston te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten stong zhes bya bar ston te /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom reveals to the Tathāgata that the world is empty.

original: 'jig rten ji ltar stong zhes bya bar ston ce na /
analyzed: 'jig rten ji ltar stong zhes bya bar ston ce na /
translated: How does it reveal that the world is empty?

original: 'jig rten na phung po stong zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: 'jig rten na phung po stong zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: It reveals that the world is empty of the aggregates.

original: 'jig rten na skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'bral par 'byung ba stong ngo zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: 'jig rten na skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'bral par 'byung ba stong ngo zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: It reveals that the world is empty of the sense spheres, elements, and dependent origination.

original: 'jig rten na pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / nang stong pa nyid dang @390b phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun stong zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: 'jig rten na pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / nang stong pa nyid dang @390b phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun stong zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: It reveals that the world is empty of the six perfections, the emptiness of internal phenomena, the emptiness of external phenomena, and the emptiness of both internal and external phenomena, up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities, and the thirty-seven factors of awakening.

original: 'jig rten na 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten na 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang /
translated: In the world, he teaches that the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions,

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams stong zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams stong zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: the emptiness gate of liberation, the signless gate of liberation, the wishless gate of liberation, the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways are empty.

original: 'jig rten na de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad stong zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: 'jig rten na de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad stong zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: In the world, he teaches that the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are empty.

original: 'jig rten na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du stong zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: 'jig rten na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du stong zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: in the world up to the knowledge of all aspects is empty.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston to //
translated: Thus, Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom produces the Tathāgata and shows the world.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya bar ston te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya bar ston te /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom shows the Tathāgata that the world is inconceivable.

original: ji ltar 'jig rten bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya bar ston ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya bar ston ce na /
translated: How does it show that the world is inconceivable?

original: phung po'i 'jig rten bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya bar ston to //🔽skye mched dang / @391a *//
analyzed: phung po'i 'jig rten bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya bar ston to // skye mched dang / @391a *//
translated: It shows that the world of the aggregates is inconceivable.🔽It shows that the world of the sense bases,

original: khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i 'jig rten bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya bar ston to //
analyzed: khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i 'jig rten bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya bar ston to //
translated: the world of the elements, and the world of dependent origination is inconceivable.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'jig rten bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya bar ston to //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'jig rten bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya bar ston to //
translated: It shows that the world up to the knowledge of all aspects is inconceivable.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, this profound perfection of wisdom

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten dben zhes bya bar ston te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten dben zhes bya bar ston te /
translated: teaches the Tathāgata that the world is empty.

original: 'jig rten ji ltar dben zhes bya bar ston ce na /
analyzed: 'jig rten ji ltar dben zhes bya bar ston ce na /
translated: How does it teach that the world is empty?

original: phung po'i 'jig rten dben zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: phung po'i 'jig rten dben zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: It teaches that the world of the aggregates is empty.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i 'jig rten dben zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i 'jig rten dben zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: It teaches that the world of the sense spheres, elements, and dependent origination is empty.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'jig rten dben zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'jig rten dben zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: It teaches that the world up to the knowledge of all aspects is empty.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston to //
translated: In that way, Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom gives birth to the Tathāgata and teaches the world.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten mtha' las 'das pa stong pa zhes bya bar ston te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten mtha' las 'das pa stong pa zhes bya bar ston te /
translated: teaches the Tathāgata that the world is empty of transcending limits.

original: ji ltar 'jig rten mtha' las 'das pa stong pa zhes bya bar ston ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten mtha' las 'das pa stong pa zhes bya bar ston ce na /
translated: How does it teach that the world is empty of what is beyond the world?

original: phung po'i 'jig rten mtha' las 'das pa stong pa zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: phung po'i 'jig rten mtha' las 'das pa stong pa zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: It teaches that the world of the aggregates is empty of what is beyond the world.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i 'jig rten mtha' las 'das pa stong pa zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i 'jig rten mtha' las 'das pa stong pa zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: It teaches that the world of the sense spheres, elements, and dependent origination is empty of what is beyond the world.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyan  pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'jig rten mtha' las 'das pa stong pa zhes bya bar ston @391b to; ;rab 'byor /🔽gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyan  pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'jig rten mtha' las 'das pa stong pa zhes bya bar ston @391b to; ;rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: It teaches that the world up to and including the knowledge of all aspects is empty of what is beyond the world.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa zhes bya bar ston te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa zhes bya bar ston te /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom teaches the Tathāgata that the world is empty of an intrinsic nature.

original: ji ltar 'jig rten ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa zhes bya bar ston ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa zhes bya bar ston ce na /
translated: How does it teach that the world is empty of an intrinsic nature?

original: phung po'i 'jig rten ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa zhes bya bar ston to /
analyzed: phung po'i 'jig rten ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa zhes bya bar ston to /
translated: It teaches that the world of the aggregates is empty of an intrinsic nature.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i 'jig rten ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i 'jig rten ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: the world of the sense-spheres, the world of the elements, and the world of dependent origination are shown to be empty of an intrinsic nature.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'jig rten ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa zhes bya ba ston to //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'jig rten ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: up to the world of the knowledge of all modes is shown to be empty of an intrinsic nature.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol phyin pa ne /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol phyin pa ne /
translated: Thus, Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom

original: de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa'o //
translated: generates the Tathāgata and shows the world.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa zhes bya bar ston te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa zhes bya bar ston te /
translated: shows the Tathāgata the world as the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-entities.

original: ji ltar 'jig rten dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa zhes bya bar ston ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa zhes bya bar ston ce na /
translated: How does it show the world as the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-entities?

original: phung po'i 'jig rten dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: phung po'i 'jig rten dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: It shows the world of the aggregates as the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-entities.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel bar byung ba'i 'jig rten dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel bar byung ba'i 'jig rten dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: the world of the sense-spheres, the world of the elements, and the world of dependent origination is shown to be empty of an intrinsic nature that is not something existent.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'jig rten dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa zhes bya bar ston to /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'jig rten dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa zhes bya bar ston to /
translated: up to the world of the knowledge of all modes is shown to be empty of an intrinsic nature that is not something existent.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten zhi zhes bya bar ston te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten zhi zhes bya bar ston te /
translated: shows the Tathāgata the world to be calm.

original: ji ltar 'jig rten zhi zhes bya bar ston ce na /🔽@392a *// phung po'i 'jig rten zhi zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten zhi zhes bya bar ston ce na / @392a *// phung po'i 'jig rten zhi zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: How does it show the world to be calm?🔽It shows the world of the aggregates to be calm.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i 'jig rten zhi zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i 'jig rten zhi zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: It shows the world of the sense-spheres, the world of the elements, and the world of dependent origination to be calm.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'jig rten zhi zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'jig rten zhi zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: It shows the world of the knowledge of all modes to be calm.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten stong pa nyid ces bya bar ston te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten stong pa nyid ces bya bar ston te /
translated: teaches the Tathāgata the emptiness of the world.

original: ji ltar 'jig rten stong pa nyid ces bya bar ston ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten stong pa nyid ces bya bar ston ce na /
translated: How does it teach the emptiness of the world?

original: phung po'i 'jig rten stong pa nyid ces bya bar ston to //
analyzed: phung po'i 'jig rten stong pa nyid ces bya bar ston to //
translated: It teaches the emptiness of the world of the aggregates.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i 'jig rten stong pa nyid ces bya bar ston to //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i 'jig rten stong pa nyid ces bya bar ston to //
translated: It teaches the emptiness of the world of the sense spheres, elements, and dependent origination.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'jig rten stong pa nyid ces bya bar ston to //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'jig rten stong pa nyid ces bya bar ston to //
translated: It teaches the emptiness of the world up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: In that way, Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom

original: de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa'o //
translated: generates the Tathāgata and teaches the world.

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'jig rten ji ltar ston ce na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'jig rten ji ltar ston ce na /
translated: Subhūti, how does this profound perfection of wisdom teach the world?

original: ci nas kyang 'jig rten 'di'i 'du shes su'ang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: ci nas kyang 'jig rten 'di'i 'du shes su'ang mi 'gyur la /
translated: In such a way that it does not become an idea of this world,

original: 'jig rten pha rol gyi 'du shes su'ang mi 'gyur ba de ltar ston te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol gyi 'du shes su'ang mi 'gyur ba de ltar ston te /
translated: He shows that it does not become the perception of this world, nor does it become the perception of the next world.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de ni 'di ltar gang gis 'jig rten 'di'i 'du shes su 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni 'di ltar gang gis 'jig rten 'di'i 'du shes su 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Why is that?🔽It is because there is no such dharma by which there would be the perception of this world,

original: 'jig rten pha rol gyi 'du shes su 'gyur ba'i chos de lta bu med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol gyi 'du shes su 'gyur ba'i chos de lta bu med do //
translated: or by which there would be the perception of the next world.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni don chen po'i slad @392b du nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni don chen po'i slad @392b du nye bar gnas so //
translated: this perfection of wisdom is present for the sake of the great meaning.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni don bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i slad du nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni don bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i slad du nye bar gnas so //
translated: this perfection of wisdom is present for the sake of the inconceivable meaning.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni don dpag tu ma mchis pa'i slad du nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni don dpag tu ma mchis pa'i slad du nye bar gnas so //
translated: this perfection of wisdom is present for the sake of the immeasurable meaning.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni don gzhal du ma mchis pa'i slad du nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni don gzhal du ma mchis pa'i slad du nye bar gnas so //
translated: this perfection of wisdom is present for the sake of the incomparable meaning.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das; shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni don mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i slad du nye bar gnas so //
translated: “Blessed One, this perfection of wisdom is present for the sake of the meaning that is equal to the unequaled.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te; shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni don chen po'i phyir nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: de de bzhin te; shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni don chen po'i phyir nye bar gnas so //

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni don bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / don dpag tu med pa dang / don gzhal du med pa dang / don mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i phyir nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni don bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / don dpag tu med pa dang / don gzhal du med pa dang / don mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i phyir nye bar gnas so //
translated: Subhūti, this perfection of wisdom is present for the sake of the inconceivable meaning, for the sake of the immeasurable meaning, for the sake of the incomparable meaning, and for the sake of the meaning that is equal to the unequaled.

original: rab 'byor / ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa don chen po'i phyir nye bar gnas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa don chen po'i phyir nye bar gnas pa yin zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, how is it that this perfection of wisdom is present for the sake of the great meaning?

original: rab 'byor / 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi don chen po ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi don chen po ste /
translated: Subhūti, this is the great meaning of the tathāgatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened buddhas.

analyzed: 'di ltar sems can thams cad bskyab pa'i don dang; sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtang ba'i don to //
translated: It is for the sake of protecting all sentient beings and not abandoning all sentient beings.

original: rab 'byor / ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa don bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir nye bar gnas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa don bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir nye bar gnas pa yin zhe na /

analyzed: rab 'byor / @393a *//

analyzed: rab 'byor / ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa don dpag tu med pa'i phyir nye bar gnas pa yin zhe na /

analyzed: rab 'byor / sems can du bsdu bas bsdus pa la /

original: gang gis sangs rgyas nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid dang / rang byung nyid dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la bsam pa dang / dpag par nus pa de lta bu gang yang med de; rab 'byor /

original: rnam grangs des na /
analyzed: rnam grangs des na /
translated: Subhūti, for this reason

analyzed: rab 'byor / ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa don gzhal du med pa'i phyir nye bar gnas pa yin zhe na /

analyzed: rab 'byor / sangs rgyas nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid dang / rang byung nyid dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni gzhal du med de /

analyzed: sus kyang gzhal bar mi nus so //

analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des na /
