translated: the perfection of wisdom is present as the immeasurable meaning of the tathāgatas, the saints, the perfectly enlightened ones.

analyzed: rab 'byor / ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni don mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i phyir nye bar gnas pa yin zhe na /

translated: Subhūti, for this reason the perfection of wisdom is present as the meaning that is equal to the unequaled of the tathāgatas, the saints, the perfectly enlightened ones.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /

original: ci'i slad du skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la bsam pa dang / dpag pa dang / tshad dang / mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam pa mi dmigs pa lags /

analyzed: dpag tu med tshad med /

translated: estimation, measure, inequality, and equality are not apprehended.

analyzed: gzhal du med pa ste /

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //

translated: Subhūti, these dharmas of a tathāgata, a tathāgata’s dharmas, are inconceivable because they are free from thought.🔽They are immeasurable because they are free from measure.

translated: and equal to the unequaled.

original: chos de dag ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
analyzed: chos de dag ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
translated: dharmas are inconceivable,

original: dpag tu med pa /
analyzed: dpag tu med pa /
translated: incalculable,

original: gzhal du med pa /
analyzed: gzhal du med pa /
translated: immeasurable,

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa ste /
translated: and equal to the unequaled.

original: de dag ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis bsam pa'am /
analyzed: de dag ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis bsam pa'am /
translated: The world with its gods, humans, and asuras cannot conceive of them,

original: dpag par mi nus te /
analyzed: dpag par mi nus te /
translated: cannot measure them,🔽and cannot fathom them.

original: de ltar na sangs rgyas rnams ni gzhal du med do //
analyzed: de ltar na sangs rgyas rnams ni gzhal du med do //
translated: Thus, the buddhas are incalculable.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni gzhal du med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni gzhal du med do //
translated: The buddhadharmas are incalculable.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis khyab pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i le'u 'di bstan pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis khyab pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i le'u 'di bstan pa'i tshe /
translated: When the Blessed One had taught this chapter on the inconceivable, immeasurable, incomparable, and equal-to-the-unequalled thusness of the Tathagata,

original: dge slong lnga brgya nye bar len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: dge slong lnga brgya nye bar len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
translated: five hundred monks were liberated from defilements without further appropriation.

original: dge slong ma brgya phrag nyi shu nye bar len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: dge slong ma brgya phrag nyi shu nye bar len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
translated: Two hundred nuns were liberated from defilements without further appropriation.

original: dge bsnyen stong phrag drug cu dang / dge bsnyen ma stong phrag sum cu ni /
analyzed: dge bsnyen stong phrag drug cu dang / dge bsnyen ma stong phrag sum cu ni /
translated: Sixty thousand male lay followers and thirty thousand female lay followers

original: chos rnams la rdul dang bral zhing dri ma dang bral ba'i chos kyi mig rnam par dag go /
analyzed: chos rnams la rdul dang bral zhing dri ma dang bral ba'i chos kyi mig rnam par dag go /
translated: purified the Dharma eye free from dust and stain with regard to phenomena.

original: byang chub sems dpa' stong phrag nyi shu ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' stong phrag nyi shu ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob ste /
translated: Twenty thousand bodhisattvas attained acceptance that phenomena are not produced.

original: de dag bcom ldan 'das kyis bskal pa bzang po 'di nyid la sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes lung bstan to //
analyzed: de dag bcom ldan 'das kyis bskal pa bzang po 'di nyid la sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes lung bstan to //
translated: The Blessed One predicted that they would become Buddhas in this very fortunate eon.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-five Thousand Lines,

original: le'u sum cu gsum mo ////
analyzed: le'u sum cu gsum mo ////
translated: this is chapter thirty-three.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: said this to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan @397b 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan @397b 'das /
translated: “Blessed One!

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni zab pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni zab pa ste /
translated: This perfection of wisdom is profound.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One!

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni don chen po'i slad du nye bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni don chen po'i slad du nye bar gnas pa'o //
translated: This perfection of wisdom abides for the sake of the great meaning.

original: don tshad ma mchis pa dang / don dpag tu ma mchis pa dang / don gzhal du ma mchis pa'i slad du nye bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: don tshad ma mchis pa dang / don dpag tu ma mchis pa dang / don gzhal du ma mchis pa'i slad du nye bar gnas pa'o //
translated: It abides for the sake of immeasurable meaning, for the sake of unfathomable meaning, for the sake of incomparable meaning.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One!

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
translated: This perfection of wisdom abides

original: don mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i slad du nye bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: don mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i slad du nye bar gnas pa'o //
translated: for the sake of meaning equal to the unequalled.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
translated: Subhūti, this perfection of wisdom

original: don chen po'i phyir nye bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: don chen po'i phyir nye bar gnas pa'o //
translated: is present for the sake of the great meaning.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
translated: This perfection of wisdom

original: don tshad med pa dang / don dpag tu med pa dang / don gzhal du med pa dang / don mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i phyir nye bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: don tshad med pa dang / don dpag tu med pa dang / don gzhal du med pa dang / don mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i phyir nye bar gnas pa'o //
translated: is present for the sake of immeasurable meaning, for the sake of unfathomable meaning, for the sake of incomparable meaning, and for the sake of equal and unequal meaning.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dir ni pha rol tu phyin pa lnga 'dus so //🔽rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dir ni; nang stong pa nyid 'dus so //
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dir ni pha rol tu phyin pa lnga 'dus so // rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dir ni; nang stong pa nyid 'dus so //
translated: Subhūti, in this perfection of wisdom the five perfections are included.🔽Subhūti, in this perfection of wisdom

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du 'dus so //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du 'dus so //
translated: the emptiness of internal phenomena is included, up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities is included.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi 'dus so //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi 'dus so //
translated: The four applications of mindfulness are included.

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa 'dus so //🔽rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol @398a *//
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa 'dus so // rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol @398a *//
translated: the four right efforts, the four legs of supernatural power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven parts of enlightenment, and the eightfold noble path are included.

original: rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'dir ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang /
analyzed: rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'dir ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang /
translated: Subhūti, in this deep perfection of wisdom the four noble truths, the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions,

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang /
translated: the emptiness gate of liberation, the signlessness gate of liberation, the wishlessness gate of liberation, the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten tathāgata powers,

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad 'dus so //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad 'dus so //
translated: the four assurances, the four unhindered knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are included.

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dir ni; rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du 'dus so //
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dir ni; rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du 'dus so //
translated: Subhūti, in this perfection of wisdom, up to the knowledge of all aspects is included.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / rgyal po rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba srid brtan par gyur pa'i rgyal po'i dgos pa'am /
analyzed: dper na / rgyal po rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba srid brtan par gyur pa'i rgyal po'i dgos pa'am /
translated: for example, whatever the king’s duties or the duties of the country of a king of the royal class anointed on the head,

original: yul gyi dgos pa gang ci 'ang rung ste /
analyzed: yul gyi dgos pa gang ci 'ang rung ste /
translated: whatever they are,

original: de dag thams cad la blon po las su bcug na /
analyzed: de dag thams cad la blon po las su bcug na /
translated: he delegates them to his ministers,

original: de'i tshe rgyal po ni rgyal po'i dgos pa dang / yul gyi dgos pa la snying las chung zhing khur bor ba yin /
analyzed: de'i tshe rgyal po ni rgyal po'i dgos pa dang / yul gyi dgos pa la snying las chung zhing khur bor ba yin /
translated: at which time the king is light in his heart and has put down his burden.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du nyan thos kyi chos sam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du nyan thos kyi chos sam /
translated: Subhūti, in the same way, whatever the duties of śrāvakas,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos sam /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos sam /
translated: whatever the duties of pratyekabuddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos sam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos sam /
translated: all the dharmas of the bodhisattvas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos @398b gang yang rung ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos @398b gang yang rung ste /
translated: or all the dharmas of the Buddhas,

original: de dag thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'dus te /
analyzed: de dag thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'dus te /
translated: are included in the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de dag gi bya ba byed do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de dag gi bya ba byed do //
translated: The perfection of wisdom does the work of all of them.

original: rab 'byor / de lta bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de lta bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, this perfection of wisdom

original: bya ba chen po'i phyir nye bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba chen po'i phyir nye bar gnas pa'o //
translated: is present for the sake of the great work.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
translated: This perfection of wisdom

original: bya ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir nye bar gnas pa'o //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni bya ba dpag tu med pa'i phyir nye bar gnas pa'o //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni bya ba gzhal du med pa'i phyir nye bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir nye bar gnas pa'o // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni bya ba dpag tu med pa'i phyir nye bar gnas pa'o // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni bya ba gzhal du med pa'i phyir nye bar gnas pa'o //
translated: is present for the sake of the inconceivable work.🔽This perfection of wisdom is present for the sake of the immeasurable work.🔽This perfection of wisdom is present for the sake of the incomparable work.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni bya ba mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i phyir nye bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni bya ba mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i phyir nye bar gnas pa'o //
translated: This perfection of wisdom is present for the sake of the unequaled work.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni /
translated: Su­bhūti, it is because this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom

original: gzugs la yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang / mngon par chags pa med par nye bar gnas pa'o //🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang / mngon par chags pa med par nye bar gnas pa'o; ;sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang /
analyzed: gzugs la yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang / mngon par chags pa med par nye bar gnas pa'o // tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang / mngon par chags pa med par nye bar gnas pa'o; ;sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang /
translated: is present without apprehending and without attachment to physical forms,🔽and it is present without apprehending and without attachment to feelings, perceptions, formative predispositions, and consciousness.

original: mngon par chags pa med par nye bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par chags pa med par nye bar gnas pa'o //
translated: It is present without apprehending and without attachment to , up to and including the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar la yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang / mngon par chags pa med par nye bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar la yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang / mngon par chags pa med par nye bar gnas pa'o //
translated: It is present without apprehending and without attachment to , up to and including unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ” “Lord!

original: ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu @399a *//
analyzed: ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu @399a *//
translated: How is it that this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom

original: phyin pa 'di gzugs la yongs su 'dzin pa ma mchis pa dang / mngon par chags pa ma mchis par nye bar gnas pa lags /
analyzed: phyin pa 'di gzugs la yongs su 'dzin pa ma mchis pa dang / mngon par chags pa ma mchis par nye bar gnas pa lags /
translated: How does this perfection of wisdom stand in a way that does not fully grasp and does not settle down on form?

original: ji ltar na tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la yongs su 'dzin pa ma mchis pa dang / mngon par chags pa ma mchis par nye bar gnas pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la yongs su 'dzin pa ma mchis pa dang / mngon par chags pa ma mchis par nye bar gnas pa lags /
translated: How does it stand in a way that does not fully grasp and does not settle down on feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness?

original: ji ltar na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar la yongs su 'dzin pa ma mchis pa dang / mngon par chags pa ma mchis par nye bar gnas pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar la yongs su 'dzin pa ma mchis pa dang / mngon par chags pa ma mchis par nye bar gnas pa lags /
translated: How does it stand in a way that does not fully grasp and does not settle down on . . . up to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /🔽khyod kyis gzugs gang yongs su gzung bar bya ba'am /🔽mngon par chags par bya ba de lta bu mthong ngam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems / khyod kyis gzugs gang yongs su gzung bar bya ba'am / mngon par chags par bya ba de lta bu mthong ngam /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?🔽Do you see that form that you should fully grasp or settle down on?

original: chos gang yongs su 'dzin par byed pa dang / mngon par chags par byed pa'am /
analyzed: chos gang yongs su 'dzin par byed pa dang / mngon par chags par byed pa'am /
translated: Do you see that dharma that you should fully grasp or settle down on?

original: gang gis yongs su gzung bar bya ba'am /🔽mngon par chags par bya ba de lta bu'ang mthong ngam /
analyzed: gang gis yongs su gzung bar bya ba'am / mngon par chags par bya ba de lta bu'ang mthong ngam /
translated: Is there anything that is seen that is to be appropriated or🔽that is to be clung to?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Subhūti, do you see any such form that can be grasped or can be attached to?”

original: de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma lags so //
translated: “No, Lord, I do not see any such form that can be grasped or can be attached to.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /🔽khyod kyis tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa gang yongs su gzung bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems / khyod kyis tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa gang yongs su gzung bar bya ba'am /
translated: The Lord said,

original: mngon par chags bar bya ba de lta bu mthong ngam /
analyzed: mngon par chags bar bya ba de lta bu mthong ngam /
translated: “Subhūti, do you see any such feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness that can be grasped or can be attached to?”🔽“No, Lord, I do not see any such feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness that can be grasped or can be attached to.”

original: chos gang yongs su 'dzin par byed pa dang / mngon par chags par byed pa'am /
analyzed: chos gang yongs su 'dzin par byed pa dang / mngon par chags par byed pa'am /
translated: “Subhūti, do you see any such dharma that can be grasped or can be attached to,

original: gang gis yongs su gzung bar bya ba'am /🔽mngon par chags par @399b bya ba de lta bu'ang mthong ngam /🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gang gis yongs su gzung bar bya ba'am / mngon par chags par @399b bya ba de lta bu'ang mthong ngam / gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: or by which one can be grasped or can be attached to?”

original: de ni ma lags so //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de ni ma lags so // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “No, Lord, I do not see any such dharma that can be grasped or can be attached to, or by which one can be grasped or can be attached to.”🔽The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Subhūti, do you see any such eye that can be grasped or can be attached to?”

original: khyod kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du gang yongs su gzung bar bya ba'am /🔽mngon par chags par bya ba de lta bu'ang mthong ngam /🔽chos gang yongs su 'dzin par byed pa dang / mngon par chags par byed pa'am; gang gis yongs su gzung bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: khyod kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du gang yongs su gzung bar bya ba'am / mngon par chags par bya ba de lta bu'ang mthong ngam / chos gang yongs su 'dzin par byed pa dang / mngon par chags par byed pa'am; gang gis yongs su gzung bar bya ba'am /
translated: “Do you see any such dharma that you could grasp or become attached to, up to and including omniscience?”

original: mngon par chags par bya ba de lta bu'ang mthong ngam /🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: mngon par chags par bya ba de lta bu'ang mthong ngam / gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Do you see any such dharma that you could grasp or become attached to, by which you could grasp or become attached to it?”

original: de ni ma lags so //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; rab 'byor /
analyzed: de ni ma lags so // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; rab 'byor /
translated: Subhūti replied, “No, Bhagavān.”

original: de ji snyam du sems /🔽khyod kyis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu gang yongs su gzung bar bya ba'am /🔽mngon par chags par bya ba de lta bu mthong ngam /🔽chos gang yongs su 'dzin par byed pa dang / mngon par chags par byed pa'am /
analyzed: de ji snyam du sems / khyod kyis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu gang yongs su gzung bar bya ba'am / mngon par chags par bya ba de lta bu mthong ngam / chos gang yongs su 'dzin par byed pa dang / mngon par chags par byed pa'am /
translated: The Bhagavān said, “What do you think, Subhūti?🔽Do you see any such result of stream enterer that you could grasp or become attached to?”

original: gang gis yongs gzung bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: gang gis yongs gzung bar bya ba'am /
translated: “Do you see any such dharma that you could grasp or become attached to, by which you could grasp or become attached to it?”🔽“Do you see any such dharma that you could grasp or become attached to, by which you could grasp or become attached to it?”

original: mngon par chags par bya ba de lta bu 'ang mthong ngam /
analyzed: mngon par chags par bya ba de lta bu 'ang mthong ngam /

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das; de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das; de ni ma lags so //
translated: He replied, “No, Bhagavān, I do not.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /🔽khyod kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub gang yongs su gzung bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems / khyod kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub gang yongs su gzung bar bya ba'am /
translated: “What do you think, Subhūti?

original: mngon par chags par bya ba de lta bu mthong ngam /
analyzed: mngon par chags par bya ba de lta bu mthong ngam /
translated: Do you see such a thing as unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening that can be grasped at or attached to?”

original: chos gang yongs su 'dzin par byed pa dang / mngon par chags par byed pa'am /
analyzed: chos gang yongs su 'dzin par byed pa dang / mngon par chags par byed pa'am /
translated: “Do you see such a thing as a dharma that can be grasped at or attached to,

original: gang gis yongs su gzung bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: gang gis yongs su gzung bar bya ba'am /
translated: or by which one can be grasped at or attached to?”

original: @400a *// mngon par chags par bya ba de lta bu'ang mthong ngam /🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: @400a *// mngon par chags par bya ba de lta bu'ang mthong ngam / gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Do you see such a thing as a dharma that can be grasped at or attached to,🔽or by which one can be grasped at or attached to?”

original: de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma lags so //
translated: He replied, “No, Bhagavān, I do not.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / legs so /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / legs so /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: legs so // rab 'byor /
analyzed: legs so // rab 'byor /
translated: “Excellent, Subhūti, excellent!

original: ngas kyang gzugs yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ste /
analyzed: ngas kyang gzugs yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ste /

original: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas yongs su mi 'dzin /
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas yongs su mi 'dzin /

original: yongs su mi 'dzin pas nye bar mi len to //
analyzed: yongs su mi 'dzin pas nye bar mi len to //
translated: Since he does not grasp at them, he does not take them up.

original: rab 'byor / ngas kyang tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ngas kyang tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ste /
translated: Subhūti, I also do not see feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas yongs su mi 'dzin /
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas yongs su mi 'dzin /
translated: Since I do not see them as real, I do not grasp at them.

original: yongs su mi 'dzin pas nye bar mi len to //
analyzed: yongs su mi 'dzin pas nye bar mi len to //
translated: Since I do not grasp at them, I do not take them up.

original: rab 'byor / ngas kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ngas kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ste /
translated: Subhūti, I also do not see up to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas yongs su mi 'dzin /
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas yongs su mi 'dzin /
translated: Since I do not see it as real, I do not grasp at it.

original: yongs su mi 'dzin pas nye bar mi len to //
analyzed: yongs su mi 'dzin pas nye bar mi len to //
translated: Since I do not grasp at it, I do not take it up.”🔽“

original: rab 'byor / ngas kyang sangs rgyas kyi sa dang / thams cad shes pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ngas kyang sangs rgyas kyi sa dang / thams cad shes pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ste /
translated: Subhūti, I also do not see the buddha stage, the state of knowing all, the state of knowing all aspects, or the Tathāgata.

original: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas yongs su mi 'dzin /
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas yongs su mi 'dzin /
translated: Since I do not see them, I do not grasp them.

original: yongs su mi 'dzin pas nye bar mi len to //
analyzed: yongs su mi 'dzin pas nye bar mi len to //
translated: Since I do not grasp them, I do not take them up.

original: rab 'byor / de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos /
translated: Subhūti, therefore bodhisattva great beings

original: gzugs la mngon par chags par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la mngon par chags par mi bya'o //
translated: should not be attached to form.

original: yongs su gzung bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su gzung bar mi bya'o //
translated: They should not grasp it.

original: tshor @400b ba dang; 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la mngon par chags par mi bya'o //
analyzed: tshor @400b ba dang; 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la mngon par chags par mi bya'o //
translated: They should not be attached to feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: yongs su gzung bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su gzung bar mi bya'o //
translated: They should not grasp it.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mngon par chags par mi bya'o //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mngon par chags par mi bya'o //
translated: They should not be attached to the sense domains, elements, or dependent origination.

original: yongs su gzung bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su gzung bar mi bya'o //
translated: They should not grasp it.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang /
translated: the perfections, the emptinesses, the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions,

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang; gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang; gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang /
translated: the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions, the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness gateways to liberation, the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, the dhāraṇī gateways,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la mngon par chags par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la mngon par chags par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not settle down on the utmost, right, and perfect enlightenment, nor should one settle down on the utmost, right, and perfect enlightenment as a name.

original: yongs su gzung bar mi bya'o //🔽bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar la mngon par chags par mi bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su gzung bar mi bya'o // bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar la mngon par chags par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not settle down on the fruit of a Streamwinner, nor should one settle down on the fruit of a Streamwinner as a name.🔽One should not settle down on the fruit of a Once-Returner, nor should one settle down on the fruit of a Once-Returner as a name.🔽One should not settle down on the fruit of a Never-Returner, nor should one settle down on the fruit of a Never-Returner as a name.🔽One should not settle down on the fruit of a Worthy One, nor should one settle down on the fruit of a Worthy One as a name.🔽One should not settle down on a Pratyekabuddha, nor should one settle down on a Pratyekabuddha as a name.

original: yongs su gzung bar mi bya'o //🔽sangs rgyas nyid dang / thams cad shes pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid la mngon par chags @401a *//🔽par mi bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su gzung bar mi bya'o // sangs rgyas nyid dang / thams cad shes pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid la mngon par chags @401a *// par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not settle down on the level of a Bodhisattva, nor should one settle down on the level of a Bodhisattva as a name.🔽One should not settle down on the level of a Buddha, nor should one settle down on the level of a Buddha as a name.🔽One should not settle down on the knowledge of all modes, nor should one settle down on the knowledge of all modes as a name.

original: yongs su gzung bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su gzung bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not settle down on the utmost, right, and perfect enlightenment, nor should one settle down on the utmost, right, and perfect enlightenment as a name.

original: de nas 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu dag gis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu dag gis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the gods of the realm of desire and the gods of the realm of form said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
translated: this perfection of wisdom

original: zab cing lta dka' la /
analyzed: zab cing lta dka' la /
translated: is profound, difficult to see, difficult to understand,

original: rtogs par dka' ba ste /
analyzed: rtogs par dka' ba ste /
translated: difficult to realize,

original: mi rtag pa rtag pa'i spyod yul ma lags pa zhi /
analyzed: mi rtag pa rtag pa'i spyod yul ma lags pa zhi /
translated: not within the sphere of activity of reasoning,

original: zhing phra la /
analyzed: zhing phra la /
translated: subtle,

original: mkhas pa dang / byang ba dang / yid gsal bas 'tshal bar bgyi ba'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa dang / byang ba dang / yid gsal bas 'tshal bar bgyi ba'o //
translated: and to be known by the learned, the wise, and the discerning.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: sems can gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mos pa de dag ni sngon gyi rgyal ba la bgyi ba bgyis pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mos pa de dag ni sngon gyi rgyal ba la bgyi ba bgyis pa'o //
translated: those beings who have faith in this profound perfection of wisdom have served the victors of the past.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: sems can gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mos pa de dag ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba'o //
analyzed: sems can gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mos pa de dag ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba'o //
translated: those beings who have faith in this profound perfection of wisdom have been accepted by spiritual friends.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'o //
translated: They have planted the roots of virtue.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba dang / chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / brgyad pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dang /
analyzed: gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba dang / chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / brgyad pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dang /
translated: “If all the sentient beings in the great trichiliocosm were to become followers of faith, followers of reality, eighth-level, stream enterers,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas su gyur te /🔽de dag thams cad la ye shes dang / spong ba gang ji snyed cig mchis pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la gdugs gcig tu mos shing bsams @401b te; gzhal ba dang / brtag pa dang / dpyad pa nyid la /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas su gyur te / de dag thams cad la ye shes dang / spong ba gang ji snyed cig mchis pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la gdugs gcig tu mos shing bsams @401b te; gzhal ba dang / brtag pa dang / dpyad pa nyid la /
translated: once-returners, non-returners, arhats, and pratyekabuddhas,🔽and if all of them were to believe in, contemplate, measure, examine, and investigate this profound perfection of wisdom for one day,🔽the wisdom and abandonment of all of them would not equal a hundredth part of the wisdom and abandonment of a bodhisattva great being who believes in, contemplates, measures, examines, and investigates this profound perfection of wisdom for one day.

original: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la gdugs gcig tu mos pa de nyid ches lags pa'i mchog tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la gdugs gcig tu mos pa de nyid ches lags pa'i mchog tu 'gyur ro //
translated: That would be the most excellent of all.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba dang / chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / brgyad pa dang / rgyun du zhugs dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes gang ji tsam pa dang /🔽spong ba gang ji tsam pa de ni /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba dang / chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / brgyad pa dang / rgyun du zhugs dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes gang ji tsam pa dang / spong ba gang ji tsam pa de ni /
translated: and the abandonment of the stream enterers, the once-returners, the non-returners, and the arhats, and the abandonment of the pratyekabuddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i bzod par 'dus so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i bzod par 'dus so //
translated: are included in the acceptance of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas that is the acceptance of the nonarising of phenomena.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu de dag la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu de dag la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Bhagavān said to the devas of the desire realm and the devas of the form realm,

original: lha'i bu dag /🔽de de bzhin no //
analyzed: lha'i bu dag / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Devas,🔽it is so, it is so.

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba dang / chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / brgyad pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes gang ji tsam pa dang /
analyzed: dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba dang / chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / brgyad pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes gang ji tsam pa dang /
translated: the stage of the one who practices in accordance with faith, the stage of the one who practices in accordance with the Dharma, the eighth stage, the stage of the stream-winner, the stage of the once-returner, the stage of the non-returner, the stage of the arhat, the knowledge of a pratyekabuddha,

original: spong ba gang ji tsam pa de ni /
analyzed: spong ba gang ji tsam pa de ni /
translated: and the abandonment of a pratyekabuddha—

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i bzod par 'dus so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i bzod par 'dus so //
translated: all that is included in the acceptance of the bodhisattva mahāsattva who has attained acceptance of the fact that phenomena are not produced.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: “Divine princes,

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang su'ang rung ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang su'ang rung ste /
translated: any son of a good family or daughter of a good family

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyan cing thos nas 'dri ba dang / bris nas lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du @402a *//
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyan cing thos nas 'dri ba dang / bris nas lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du @402a *//
translated: who listens to this deep perfection of wisdom, after listening writes it down, after writing it down memorizes it, after memorizing it recites it, after reciting it teaches it, after teaching it practices it, and after practicing it teaches it extensively to others,

original: yid la byed pa de dag ni myur du 'byung bar shes bar bya'o /
analyzed: yid la byed pa de dag ni myur du 'byung bar shes bar bya'o /
translated: you should know that they will quickly appear.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba /🔽mdo sde gzhan la bskal pa'am /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba / mdo sde gzhan la bskal pa'am /
translated: It is not the sons of noble family and daughters of noble family who follow the vehicle of the hearers and the vehicle of the solitary buddhas, who are divorced from the perfection of wisdom,🔽who practice the other sūtras for an eon

original: bskal pa'i lhag mar spyod pa de dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bskal pa'i lhag mar spyod pa de dag ni ma yin no //
translated: or for the remainder of an eon.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di las phul du bya ba'i chos gang la /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di las phul du bya ba'i chos gang la /
translated: It is because in this profound perfection of wisdom the qualities that are the best

original: dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba dang / chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / brgyad pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis bslab par bya ba dang /
analyzed: dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba dang / chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / brgyad pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis bslab par bya ba dang /
translated: are the qualities that the followers of faith, the followers of reality, the eighth-­level practitioners, the stream enterers, the once-­returners, the nonreturners, the arhats, and the pratyekabuddhas should train in.

original: gang la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis bslab par bya ba dang / gang la de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis bslabs te /
analyzed: gang la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis bslab par bya ba dang / gang la de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis bslabs te /
translated: It is that in which the bodhisattva mahāsattvas should train, and in which the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas have trained,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang / mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba de dag rgya cher bstan to //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang / mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba de dag rgya cher bstan to //
translated: and will train, and are training, for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”
